nbCHvdy3KCi7t-i4xlNn8Q.review_text: Thank you Grumpy's for your fight to remove Off the Grid from our lunch-less neighborhood.  Thanks to you my options have whittled back down to approx 1 subway, 1 sandwich spot and 2 cafes.  such a plethora of options, it's fantastic!  You guys are assholes.  p.s. I haven't eaten at your restaurant in 2 years due to the poor quality of your burgers and limp frozen french fries.  Double disappointment.

SUq3r0GXuAO-je66Dj03KQ.review_text: I can't believe I haven't written a review about the best after work bar in the city (or at least in Multi-media gulch).  Grumpy's is a great place to wind down after work during happy hour. They have HH specials all week. It's also a great place to eat. From their appetizers to their burgers and salads, their food is delicious. Just note, that you cannot get a salad after about 5:00 pm. But why would you when their burgers and fries are amazing. I've heard their turkey burger is one of the best in town. I have never eaten it myself, but I trust the folks I've heard this from.  Drinks are their specialty. But not in terms of fru-fru drinks like Mojitos, but real drinks like Vodka & Soda, Jack and Coke, etc. From Monday - Wednesday (I think), you can get a shot and a draft for $7. They have a list of liquors that you can get for the shot.  Friday's special is usually 24 oz Tecate beers for something like $3! That's just plain crazy!  But the most amazing this is they just started carrying Miller High Life! The Champagne of Beers!   If you work (or live) in the neighborhood, you should wander over to Grumpy's for a drink or two. The place is nice, the bartenders are great and the regulars are a colorful bunch. Sit at the bar and an interesting conversation is minutes away.  Cheers!

XpmEAF_BONORa64-17Moxg.review_text: Pretty great spot for a hangover cure.  This is a wonderful place for a vegetarian because you can make any of their specialty burgers into a veggie burger (or grilled chicken, or a turkey burger...).   I most clearly remember the Greek- with avocado, cucumber and feta- but I don't like the mushiness of the avo (more like guacamole).  I'm leaning towards the regular, no-fuss veggie, with good ol' mustard and catchup these days.  It's very good!  Also, there is something to be said about their "side" salad, which I normally get instead of fries.  It's a huge pile of greenery, with all sorts of beans, veggies and hard boiled eggs on top.  Get the balsamic dressing-- it is tangy and a little sweet and PERFECT.  One odd thing I notice about this pub is that no one ever knows how to make a black velvet.  Hm...

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text: i bumped into this hidden little bar one day and boy is it hidden. its right near all the TV stations and always has just enough people not to feel empty. great beer selection.

M6vv_thbXnji_EF_Gq1P2Q.review_text: Alright. It's not just the beer.  But their food is excellent!  Cafe Sprout Turkey Burger (for only about $10) = the best turkey burger I've ever had!!! Topped with sprouts, avocado, and monterey jack cheese. It comes with a side of fries, potato salad, or mixed greens. Even the side salad is great! -- Fresh greens topped with garbanzo beans, kidney beans, and olives (the balsalmic dressing is great!)  I don't know where they source their burger meats from...but man is it juicy!  And those $1 garlic fries during Happy Hour (Tuesdays) are delicious!  Great food at a great price + friendly, smiley service + large selection of beers = 5 stars.   So happy this place is just a block from work!

-RF8CPXzDESEwNuPZ4QHhQ.review_text: Love this place!  You have to check it out yourself.  Burgers are delicious.  Bartenders are friendly.

FocjwNt9GbOSln9iFCFwtQ.review_text: Love this place! Great burgers, yummy fries and awesome service.   They have about 10-12 different types of burgers and I think all are $9.95. Forget being healthy and forgo the turkey, veggie, and chicken option...stick with the beef patty! At least try it once! It's juicy, flavorful and substantial.   I hear the happy hour is good too. You won't leave grumpy! ;P

8vOYRdOpxEcxK17DA4-6eQ.review_text: Loved this place. Small bar with a great craft beer selection.  Spoke to Kevin (I think he was the owner), who was tending bar.  Very cool dude that is one reason I'd go back to SF for another vacation. Place has great atmosphere.  Mostly locals were there.  I could have stayed for hours.....it's that kind of place.

DyiSA0yxVGN8zSRaYHoyMA.review_text: The macaroni and cheese here is to die for. I have been to Grumpy's a dozen times or more, and would kill for their mac and cheese recipe. You can substitute anything off the sides for it, and I highly encourage you do.  The burgers are awesome; fat and juicy. The fried chicken, lamb and trout items at the bottom of the menu are worth exploring, and reasonably priced. I had the grilled trout today, it took forever to come out, but it was good. Not sure if the bar girl took it off the bill because it was so late, or it was late because it never made it on the bill, but either way, it was free. Luckily they had some Fat Tire and Anchor Steam on tap, to while away the time waiting.  Overall, a great place, well worth the trek to get there. Just for that rich mac and cheese...

1U2UScZKrZKKfwX9phTENA.review_text: It's been a great day.  It's been a shitty day.  It doesn't matter, if is a day that requires a scrumptious, delicious, salivating burger with tasty onion rings and a cold beer....this is the place to hit.  Based in the 'ad ghetto' of the city, this pub is an animal to deal with on a Friday evening as all the local ad agencies flock here.  But if you can elbow your way to the bar and belly up, you're in for a treat.  If you have read my reviews, I love places that are simple, have attentive staff, genuine + low-key patrons  and well cooked food.  I got the baja burger on this particular trip, but I'll be back to destroy each and every burger on their list.  See you there.

O2WfOgwdSxIl-4UkqY88dA.review_text: This place has the best turkey burger in town! Around my office, Friday is known as Grumpy's Turkey Burger Day!

4IjzfbO7XKFNWWVufHNhww.review_text: I'm a Grumpy's convert. Great local happy hour that includes $3 Tecate tall cans on Fridays. Yummy all beef hotdogs with cheese and onions. Incredibly crowded during weekday lunch unless you get there at 11:45 or earlier. Good crowd overall and friendly bartenders.

f_Gs3jGb32G5p-9EO4UYAw.review_text: If you can handle the cacaphony of noise that's continually at maximum volume when the place is full, this is an awesome place to go with a friend or two.  I've been here twice strictly for the food (I don't drink) - both in the early evening during the week.  The first time I had a killer burger, the last time it was a chili dog.    Now neither of those is very healthy for someone who is really needing to eat only health-type foods.  Yet Every once in a while I just want to chow down, and both times, Grumpy's has hit a home run on that count.  Simply extraordinary food.    Now if there were just a way to get the volume down 6 notches from all the people talking...

hzJpuehCf7OR_UwEB9O5xw.review_text: I left Grumpy's a little grumpy.  Their burgers are mouthwatering.  I usually order the Baja and it never disappoints.  Their fries are good as well.. not the best out there but I like them.  Their service though leaves something to be desired.  I've always gone when it was super packed so I figure their service suffered due to the overwhelming amount of people.  But when I went today, there were only a couple other tables and it was still difficult to get our waitress to make an appearance at our table.  We eventually had to hail down the busboy to get us refills and to-go boxes.  And on that note, they charge for refills.  I don't know a lot of restaurants that still charge for refills so I'm not a huge fan of those places that nickle and dime their customers.  Burgers are on the pricier side but like I mentioned at the beginning, they are mouthwatering so I would definitely still order their burgers.. but maybe just to-go.

-gJJzPghhC_gwHT-D8wlKQ.review_text: This place was pretty good I think I had a mushroom burger, It was good but not cheap. Ambiance is great, seems like there's a heavy lunch crowd, maybe get there early if you can't take a long lunch. Seems like a more fantastic location for drinks after work.  It's a bit far for lunch from work for me, but I met a friend here on the day I went. I probably wouldn't come back unless I was meeting friends.

06d53g0Qttz1MlgP6VUYCg.review_text: I came here last week for a quick bite to eat and loved it! The food is delicious and the bartender we had was very polite. Would definitely come here again! Also love the small cuteness of the place!

a4Og4FjZAdjwxNhb1bp1xw.review_text: This is the best pub ever... I love the bartender guy that works there, he's super cool and super nice.  Most bar tenders are usually rude when it's busy, not here!  I love their fries with bacon, egg and cheese on top!

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: Total ad bar as proven by the many namesakes on the walls but every good ad bar has an equally good hangover menu because ad people, well they drink.  For a hangover, there can be fewer better things than the super burger. Juicy burger done the way you like it topped with cheddar cheese, bacon, and a fried egg. Some call it breakfast, I call it recovery. For less woozy days, explore their many other burgers. I like the Popeye - sautéed spinach and feta cheese. Decent pub food overall. They have decent fish and chips here although the wait for that during lunch was really long. Speaking of waits, forget about getting a table during happy hour as Grumpy's will be packed with folks enjoying post-work happy hour specials like a beer and a shot for $7 Mon-Wed.  Decent pub with equally good pub grub that is worth a stop in if you're looking for a watering hole in the neighborhood. Just be warned that it does get very crowded on weeknights.

W7DI4hNfWCw1ymJh98plhA.review_text: Really cool dive that can get a little crowded. There are lots of tables, but you have to suck your gut in and squeeze through the crowd to get to one. The restrooms are clean...surprising for a dive bar.  Beer selection is super weak, but they have a full bar to make up for it. Fun place to get drunk and watch a game. I didn't try the food, but it looks like they have a breakfast menu. A bar that opens for breakfast? I love it already.

cTrlhfni7C3xFlyIL3x1bQ.review_text: Came here last week on a very rare, hot day in the city. The outdoor seating was perfectly shaded and I was lucky enough to snag a table. It was lunch hour and really busy so the service was spotty but the great food and family-run business feel made up for it. In an area surrounded by high end restaurants and overpriced menus its great to have this place as an option.   I had the BBQ bacon cheeseburger and it was REALLY good. Hopefully next time I come back I'll be as impressed with the services as I was with the food.

0CqAmHUSWPEQdrnCbDiaVA.review_text: I was very pleasantly surprised by my visit to Grumpy's!  We were starving, after eating a gross 2 bites of breakfast at 11am, and made our way into Grumpy's around 5pm.  I ordered us some onion rings to get the hunger edge off, and they were cooked perfectly and very tasty.  Next, we both ordered some burgers.  I'm not gonna lie, I had low expectations for this random pub that was a little bit grungy all by itself on a random street in SF.  The burger, though, was AWESOME.  It was perfectly cooked, very tasty, and hit the spot nicely.  ANNNND...I'm about 90% sure that it was NOT just because we were starving.  I had the western burger, and BBQ sauce on it was great, particularly in combination with the bacon, cheddar, and onions.  Very good show, Grumpy's...  My friend had the California Burger (I think), which was decidedly less epic, but still cooked to perfection, juicy, and tasty...  The fries were pretty good, and the bar staff were super friendly, both in taking orders, answering questions about the menu, and in answering our questions about the cable cars and other touristy things.  Well done, Grumpy's.  You exceeded my expectations, and I thank you for that...

efoyeP8akhgtwJm-hI_hsA.review_text: BREAKFAST !! - if you dare :-) seriously, they serve up a great breakfast (bacon galore) even if you don't have a hangover, you should try it out

EMXuxsOgR1jp8FctD3limQ.review_text: I would give it 5 stars but it would detract from my yelp legitimacy. Great for happy hour--just out of reach of the financial district so not a lot of suits (not that there's anything wrong with that). Great ambiance and crowd--great staff--simple...the way a bar should be.

5BdMZJKYHopQ1ijvTRqnbA.review_text: The burger was slightly bigger than average.  The service was extremely fast, but then again I was the only 1 at the place.  I definitely want to return for happy hour, and they have a $4 margarita special on Thursdays from 4pm til closing.  Too bad I had lunch at 2:30 and still had work to return to.  I like their thinly cut fries and they had a large selection of alcohol, but I had to settle for a bottled root beer instead.  They have a good selection of rock music playing too, and their trap door which was right by my table was a nice touch.

eo0tmepvnDLQfpY2O78o_A.review_text: One of the best "scecret spots" in the City and even though its in the Financial, you'll see guys in suits sitting next to bike messengers and such.  They got Fat Tire, Fernet, decent whiskey and good burgers-what more could you ask for?  Order your fries "Patrick Style" if you want 'em crunchy!

HgHQKADOWOsBPsNv4PpLqw.review_text: Good drinks.  Good prices.  Good place to unwind at the end of the day or grab a really good burger and fries.  I work in the area and have been coming here off and on for the past couple of years.  I usually go in for a quick pint or two in the evening.   I have noticed the  food has been getting really really  good in the recent few months. Before the quality of the food was just okay.  But now-whatever these guys are doing in the kitchen is working.  Everything seems to cooked to the right temperature, juicier and plain just more fresh.    Try the Super...hands down one of the best burgers in San Francisco.

SQ9ermj-wUcEc9lCojEiOw.review_text: This place has the best burgers. The service was a bit slow because of the lunch hour rush, so get there early if you want to be served quickly.  Great place also for after work drinks.

VS2UhdMT4zFx4c_wUClDzg.review_text: This place is small and gets packed quick. Good happy hour. We were there on a Friday and can't beat the $3 Tecates.   I have been here for burgers and fries and it sooooo delicious.   Looking forward to another happy hour here, although I will have to arrive early to get a good seat.

GTmTZsReNNLRpp77C06iQw.review_text: Super busy bar during after work/happy hour time, but service was amazing. Bartenders were very attentive, even though the place was packed and spilling outside. Food was delicious and affordable too.

KfEgttGxJOtUgq2baEt0QQ.review_text: This is a small local American Pub with friendly staff members, great food and a full bar.  There is seating available outside, and heat lamps when cold.  When you first walk it, especially during lunch (11:30-1:30) it can get pretty loud and crowded.  Especially during a SF Giants day game.  Those days, I would just call in my order which will take 10-15 minutes.  Which really means 20-25 minutes. LOL.   I come here for lunch, lunch meetings, etc.. because its across the street from where I work.  I recommend trying their fish n chips.  It never seems to fail my hunger.   You also have the option to cook your burger meat to order, I like it medium rare, bacon cheese burger is good.  Also, they have a good menu for breakfast as well, in this case I suggest ordering the corn beef hash with egg.  YUM! I am curious how their happy hour is because the pricing seems fair.  This is probably the place to be in this area during St. Patrick's day or during our local SF Giants Game Day.   This is always a convenient stop for me during a busy work day.

Jo-YXrLSHok2c_eHvEFyZQ.review_text: I had a great lunch at Grumpy's today.  I was looking for a perfectly poured pint of Guiness and something good to eat.  Grumpy's delivered with an excellent turkey pastrami reuben.  The house salad instead of fries was great, too (lots of good stuff, not iceberg lettuce with a tomato wedge).  And, the service was great, with a friendly staff.  I'll be back.

kitAOxUSgFGhR3JLPrDCvg.review_text: One of the better places for lunch in the neighborhood. Good burgers and salads. Once upon a time, I was pleasantly surprised by their fried chicken too. Their Guinness is a hit or miss though, a few times it was sour! Blech.

BrETNZLefIOtiqcNX2pdrw.review_text: Media, Agency, Digital worlds collide with drinks and food. They close early on weekdays but have beer + shot specials.

1iEcnM2SMRms5xEkU8mavg.review_text: I work around the area and once in a while when we get tired of other stuff around we go to Grumpy's.  The burgers are very decent and I've found both the fries and salad that come as side dishes really good.  The only complaint I have about this place is that they are slow. I mean, like sitting down and waiting about 20 minutes to get someone to bring you water and take your order. The wait staff always looks like they are in a frenzy but then when they do come over, they don't bother to apologize for the wait.  And speaking of wait, the place gets packed at lunch time and you can wait up to a half hour to get a table. They also like to do the "do you mind sitting at another table so a bigger party can take this table" B.S. and I can't stand that. The other day I saw them doing it to people who had their drinks already. Pathetic.   So if you're going for a super early or super late lunch it may be a good experience. If you're going between 11:30 and 1:30 have a snack before heading out.

1g_ajkmxzivqpY8E9s9sgQ.review_text: Everyone says you should try the burgers and it's true, you should.

ow7QOpOgeKpYNugrzLLk8A.review_text: This review is for lunch only.  I havent tried it for drinks...yet. Walking in you see that it's not a very big restaurant but feels more homey than bigger pubs. We noticed that the ceiling had lots of dollar bills pinned to it. We were told that it has to do with happy hour held long ago.  Our server was friendly. I ordered the tuna melt, mac n cheese and fries. The mac is your typical pub mac and cheese. Runny cheese sauce poured on top of elbow macaroni with a sprinkle of black pepper. Tuna melt was better than average. Layered with caramelized red onions and cheese. Tuna is browned on one side which adds dimension to the taste as opposed to your typical tuna heated on bread with cheese. Fries were typical too. Kinda soggy.  The tuna melt was the winner and will bring me back.  If you're looking for a more cozy pub, check this place out.

vWpe19iYR30nE8JvBtjwKg.review_text:
Why would anyone name this bar Grumpy's?  Nothing grumpy about it!  Although a little dangerous on the Friday happy hour scene....that wouldn't make anyone 'grumpy' per se...
  Cute little hideaway near work and best turkey burger I have ever tasted!

Z6cvyZxAIh-WpsQ2I32i5w.review_text: Ugh. So torn.   Service: 1 star Food: 4 stars  What's a gal to do? Honestly, I don't think I've ever come here where there wasn't an absurd situation with the service. Like, forgetting to put bacon on my bacon cheeseburger. Or not bringing out the second round of beers we all ordered. Or forgetting my side of ranch (EVERY time!) Or just not coming to take our order...period.  But......the burgers! Ah, they can put a smile on anyone's face. Even the faces of those who have been snubbed by rude servers who claim you can't split a bill 2 ways.  So fine, 4 stars.   Tip: Get the turkey burger Baja style (comes with avocado, cheese, bacon, and salsa). For some reason I prefer the turkey burger here!

jy-YyFaGgbzuoJe6nMBDYw.review_text: I like the Turkey burgers and the pitchers of beer.

zy2cNfG4lLE3SlY9p2OL-A.review_text: This is just a pub!  Ok three stars for effort.  We had a customer meeting and we were about two hours early, so the Sales guy had to bring his engineer (ME) and our boss here.  Perhaps my East Coast boss was impressed, I was NOT.  Enough of having these geeks or biz people from boring USA cities to tell us where to go .. this was ... OH LAWD!  Coooooooooooold at nooon, we waited forever for our FATTY BURGER!  Point?   I don't know.. I should shut up!   Not everyone are expat kids who know the worldly thangs.  Oh well, ignorance is abundant in AMERICA!

OxfZD8hXKwy6n73QFRBoeg.review_text: Awesome food. Dive bar atmosphere. Great bartender/ wait staff. Bartender accidentally dropped a burger and gave it to us on the house. The replacement came out quick. He was extremely apologetic. I ordered a Baja Burger complete with avocado, bacon, "jack," and fresh salsa. It was delicious! One of the better burgers I've ever had. Very fresh ingredients. The people I came with got other burgers and loved them too! The onion rings and potato salad were excellent as well! I highly recommend it.

6MaQYVeeS2kjXFIcNpdYBA.review_text: Had a great turkey burger here for lunch the other day.  Service was quick, especially since they were pretty busy due to the baseball game.  Anyway, I'll be back for the PBR and a shot of whiskey special.

vvfmy5F2AZVkO3XThVqQGA.review_text: Awesome burgers for sure, any place that will add a fried egg to a bacon cheese burger is ok with me. Just don't try to move too fast for a few hours after eatiing one.   Try it out on a Thursday evening for 4$ pint glass Margaritas.

WJgvuMABGNSFhioQXvaFxw.review_text: Love Grumpys! It's my go to place after work. The bartenders are great, they make you feel right at home. Foods great, you can hang out in the street & drink beer while chatting with the locals. I highly recommend it!

B33KEetBrqpnJbQZetY3sQ.review_text: Back in the dot-com boom (version 1.0) I worked across the street from Grumpy's in the two story brick warehouse.  It was great.  We used to call Grumpy's our satellite office because so many people would relocate there for "heavy thinking" during the day.   I had Grumps on speed dial in my office so I could order up a hot dog for lunch (though they changed suppliers on those and the quality went rapidly downhill for no reason).   I remember when we'd throw massive parties in our company and people would shout down to the people drinking at Grumpy's that we had free booze, and yeah, we did.  I had never drunk to excess (I was a deprived child) before my nights at Grumpy's, but that bar put me down a path to a more interesting life.  Those were good times.  They didn't last.  They never do.

1IJQuwcmtWbMZKDvZD_rdw.review_text: yeah theres a garbage can in the front of the place. yeah you get bad service if you ask stupid ass questions like splitting bills or my hamburger isnt 'garnished right', or the funniest one, 'im not comfortable in my table. can i take that table for 4'? its a busy ass PUB you asses. what do you expect?  but like it or not, this place has one of the best burgers in the financial district. thats why its always busy. ive never recieved bad service here, never had bugs on my salad,  or had anyone of these good, down to earth people 'roll' their eyes at me. maybe its cause i dont act like a trust fund baby and expects them to wipe my mouth for me.

3IBoCe--upk24sxjM-xcxA.review_text: If I had to choose a last meal, it would have to be a hamburger.  Interesting way to start off the review, I know, because now it's probably automatically assumed I have named Grumpy's as my favorite hamburger of all time...anyone reading my reviews must know I love hamburgers...  Well they do make a great burger.  I never go crazy with the specialty burgers here.  I've been about 4 times or so.  I just love the basic cheeseburger and having a beer.  It's just solid.  It's a fun little pub near the Embarcadero with a cool staff, atmosphere and a solid burger.  Not sure I can drag the review out much more than that.  So is it my favorite burger of all time forever and ever? I know everyone is wondering. K, good talk.

7S6geHhDFDexPPl611n9jQ.review_text: SF's hidden gem. Best burgers in town. Meat melts in your mouth. If you are trying to watch your girlish figure, the side salad is huge and tasty. I would recommend the Super burger. Fried egg, bacon..... heaven.

fGkpW1GpmRUQ4E3vEJTn8w.review_text: I first discovered Grumpy's several years ago when a friend and I were wandering around town on a Friday afternoon and happened by it and decided to go in for a beer.  Fast forward to bartime: we're still sitting at the bar with our new buddy, Jimmy, the bartender.    While Grumpy's didn't exactly become a regular haunt, I do still enjoy going there.  The food is good as well as the beer selection, and the bartenders are friendly.  I went for lunch the other day and found that the table service wasn't great, but you can order food at the bar and I've had good service when I've done that.  If you work in the FiDi or Embarcadero area, Grumpy's is a great place to go for a beer after work.

e4GGA7zthQuR0OVpV8EpLg.review_text: I work next-door to this place and love coming here with coworkers and friends on occasion.  Great drinks, great food, great staff. I rate things relative to my expectations and this place exceeds my expectations in terms of food quality and other things overall, so I give Grumpy's a 5/5.

EU2V6NOtkDkMtbIJEeEjzw.review_text: Great neighborhood feel - even in this non-neighborhood part of town.  Surprisingly good food - burgers are great, as are salads.  Wine is terrible, but then who goes to a pub to have good wine?  Great cheap beer on tap and bottles - every seems to know everyone else's name.  A great place for lunch or happy hour - no pretense and a good place for groups of friends.

qdXv5FlK9QQiqkr1Cb3LxA.review_text: Great burgers!  For the price I rather eat here than bistro burger anyday.  My personal favorite is the baja burger medium rare.    nice piece of meat with bacon cheese and salsa over the top.  Choice of potato salad, green salad or fries.  Fries are always packed in the container when you arrive to they retain freshness.  Drinks are cheap and strong.  Definitley a great burger joint.

LEho8AFSA-H6M9SekKxb_A.review_text: Their burgers are soooo dammmnnn goooood!  Everytime, the burger patty is cooked perfectly.  It's never burnt, never too bloody, and always juicy.  The burger and fries portions are huge!  I only eat at this place when I know I can be in a food coma for the rest of the afternoon at work.  They do tend to take a little longer prepping your food.  I've done a few sit downs there, and it'll take a good 20 minutes for your burger to come out.  They do take phone orders, so I recommend that route if you're in a hurry.

cCPjASKs5YpMB4BmN2oSZg.review_text: The two guys sitting at the bar next to me have been coming to Grumpy's for years, and were quick to offer tips on good apps there: skins and onion rings. However, I was there solely to try the bacon cheeseburger. Fortunately, they acknowledged the burger section as the best part of Grumpy's menu. Keep in mind that we're talking pub food; fanciness isn't expected, but rather good quality for a good price.   You can't help but like a bar full of local media/advertising people who want to talk about anything but work. Personal pinions spill out after being sewn in by a long day of objective or targeted speech. Grumpy's is a straightforward local pub that will continue to be popular for years. And while my fun experience there made me want to like the burger a lot, I can't say it's one of my favorites from this burger quest over the past nine months.  The sesame bun was average and the patty itself was cooked medium rare, not medium as ordered. That's ok, because the bacon was present in every bite, and the juice from the patty and toppings filtered down to my fries, just as I'd hoped. The fries themselves were decent, roughly on par the burger.   Overall, Grumpy's should never disappoint, especially if you get a burger there. Go there for a beer and stay for a couple more. Order one of their specialty burgers if you're looking to be wowed, and consider the sauteed mushrooms, which seemed to be a popular topping.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: Good for drinks after work. Decent burgers at lunch, ok fries. I liked the variety of options for the burgers as well...

beYxtgReTb09Dsg-4mH4SA.review_text: Amazing burgers, wonderful staff, good pricing for such large portions!

gApyjyiWkbCCsoA-XBWe8w.review_text: Went there with my ex qiwi boyfriend for their happy hours. Have you tried their burger and fries yet? They were absolutely delicious. It was crowded...so we had to stand the whole time...after drinking 3 tecates..it is no big deal.

J0G7SAItOT4opuLSK2-tmw.review_text: The food is good, but like their name foreshadows, the employees are majorly grumpy. This was some of the worst service I've received, from the waitress throwing down napkins and utensils on our table to her unprofessional behavior during the payment process (Oh, wait, you guys paid $100? *Removes some of the change she gave to us).

y3b74lGLewd-591KO4uYeg.review_text: Used to eat here for lunch when I worked in the financial district. I would always build my burger and have a side of garlic fries. This place is very loud, but if you can stand the noise, it offers good food, friendly service, and makes you want to keep coming back.

Se0Eik7nVMVUh95mM1sSVA.review_text: Love love love their burgers! I've had the Greek and the Baja burgers. Portions are huge for a girl, you could share of course! If it is your first time visit, make sure take a dollar bill and stick it to the ceiling for good luck! They also have weekday happy hours. The restaurant gets busy between 11:30 - 1:30 for lunch people.

DQQHR9lLcLuHVCfrHvKioQ.review_text: Grumpy Burgers are good. Grumpy Fries are good. I swear all of their food is Sysco, but somehow they make it all tasty. Perhaps they fry their food in Bacon grease, I hear that makes anything taste good.   Minus one star for the crowd at lunch. Not Grumpy's fault, but still irritating to wait too long or loose a table over an office crowd.

EUDuSd11Fhxm6ioLgvxFEQ.review_text: This is a killer little bar that i only heard of by accident.  The booze flows like water and the afterwork crowd is nice and rambunctious...  just the way i like it.  Also, great choice of finger foods for when you are "having dinner" before a night out...  yeah, they are all fried (well and burgers), but what else do you want while you are pounding a few pints?

iRgghRapQ-tdw4NndgfHjw.review_text: I LOVE Grumpy's!  Total hole in the wall but great burgers.  My favorite is the Baja Burger!!  My son loves the Western. The place gets VERY busy at lunchtime so get there early.  They cook everything to order so it does take a while.

dhuWV1YmyMhjCTS4bh1uoA.review_text: YUM! Great burgers - tons of choices. Their garden salad comes with chick peas, beans and egg! So good. The fries are also good and my co-worker swears their breakfast sandwiches are a must! Good service but prices are on the higher-end ($8-9/burger).

ob0N8eC4293FUWljILXW-w.review_text: I like goin to this place when i wanna get out of the hustle and bustle of fidi, and enjoy some lunch with a companion outside. today in particular i knew i couldn't linger, so it was bam bam order food bam pay and conversation in between. so service was quick, and the burger was delish, though most impressive was their side green salad, which was actually a great big green salad with LOTS of lettuce and things.   i will def go to grumpy's again for their out-of-the-way location, outdoor seating and good food.

ehj5QpeDuXqbk17a9SvUNw.review_text: Take out was fantastic. Tuna Melts fries and salad. And not a long wait even when crowded with a helpful bar staff.

vFpv-V1AY9qC2WnMrAn1pg.review_text: Came here with my co-workers for work and it was packed at 1pm on a Friday afternoon. We thought we would beat the crowd but every table was filled. Almost everyone ordered the Super burger in my party and it looked amazing with the egg on top! I actually ordered the chicken curry salad sandwich because I was trying to be good with eating healthy but failed since I ordered onion rings. The sandwich was amazing but I'm giving this place only three stars because the service isn't awesome and it will always be crowded. I'll come here during their non busy hours for sure though.

ox74hiLubQtUY0U9jjr3cQ.review_text: Great food, great atmosphere, great staff.  The people who run Grumpy's are smart. They picked a prime location in-between two large television stations in San Francisco -- they know the secret of the TV people...we like to eat good food.  This place definitely has good food. Great food, in fact. A relaxed, comfortable atmosphere meshes with a cheerful and friendly staff.  They get busy around lunchtime, but you can always call in your order to go. Great stop for a drink after work.  Try the burgers once, then come back and try any dish that comes with mac and cheese. Yum.

unJsPznjZ5DUXqJgoPvmkg.review_text: I take that back. Burgers are pretty tasty, but if it's not lunch time, forget it. They close the kitchen early and send the guy home. And waiting for a drink while the bartender cleans tables and plays dice... SUCKS!

3HHLpfU7q4HoREEOXtt7pw.review_text: I came to Grumpy's with some of my coworkers for a welcome lunch and had a great time! This was the first time I had ever been there.  Grumpy's is a casual spot for lunch to grab some beers and burgers. It's great for groups, even though the place is small, and it seemed like it was a popular place with tons of regulars.  After looking at the menu, we pretty much all ordered burgers and fries. From a basic cheeseburger to one of their specialty burgers, everyone was very happy with the food. I ordered a regular cheeseburger and it was cooked to my liking and it was pretty tasty. The fries were good but I wish they gave you more!   Service was great - our server was very attentive and always made sure our glasses were refilled. Food came out in a timely manner and they really do their best to get food and drinks out since it is busy and on the smaller side.  I'd definitely recommend Grumpy's for lunch, just get there earlier so that you won't have to wait. It also seems like a good spot to catch a game or go to HH!

QUw6VXBnl3h7WaTPfMfXLg.review_text: only at there for lunch - i'm new to the neighborhood.  my salad was surprisingly good, very tasty grilled chicken.   the waitress was quite the space cadett...  excited to go back and try a cheeseburger!  and maybe a beer for post work hours...

CkPCj_p-fFr5EqzvvOYnaQ.review_text: Great burgers and friendly service. This was a good spot for lunch only a block away from the crowds on the Embarcadero.

6zjoJQiv9m5ww99PhKTqFw.review_text: Surprisingly great burgers here. The burgers are huge and the fixings on them make it even more delicious. It'll definitely fill you up. The fries are ok, but I prefer the onion rings. It has the light batter that I like.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: It's Friday and I AM GRUMPY. Grumpy that all the FB posts lately and all this weekend will be about EDC in Vegas. That or people thinking that they're sportscasters for the night. Grumpy that everyone and their mama, baby's mama, baby's daddy are at EDC (I don't even like raves) right now as I type. Grumpy that everyone has an excuse to act a drunken hot mess at EDC and I'm sober. Grumpy that everyone has an excuse to whore out at EDC as I sit here in my granny panties. Yah SO I'm just a grumpy jealous beezie today but thankfully not as grumpy as Kim Kardashian and Kanye's daughter will be in 16 years... Who da eff names their kid "North"? North West? WTF! Oh yah, btw the buffalo wings at Grumpy's are kick ass and they have real dollar bills stuck to the ceiling: bit.ly/16m0v9n! Holla! OTHER NOTES: *Older FiDi crowd w/ no eyecandy. *Divey pub with a full menu ($3.95-$10.95); from breakfast foods (served till 11 am) to salads, sammies, signature burgers, fried chicken and chili. *HH is Monday - Friday, 5 pm - 7 pm --Snapshot of online HH menu: bit.ly/12REr8w --$1 Garlic fries on Monday - Wednesday *No waiter service. Place your food order at the bar. *Buffalo Wings ($5.95) were some of the best I've had: bit.ly/183kxtt! Their crisp and juicy and the sauce is indescribably tangy and spicy with a touch of smoky sweetness. *Decent drinks. Stiff Hendrick's Tonic was $8. *Very clean restrooms w/ Dyson hands-free dryers. *Odd operating hours. Closes at 10 pm AND they're closed on the weekends. WTF? *Be VERY careful as you're crossing the streets in the surrounding area; there are no stop signs and cars drive by really fast. *Very easy street parking.

Nd9VeCv885fxyHMMhRM2tg.review_text: Just awful. We grabbed it to go through our office and I had to throw away my "Greek" salad. I say "Greek" because the salad was sloppy and didn't have the standard dressing for this style of salad. Also, we had called the order ahead of time and asked them to label all of the orders, which they did not.   Half of us (there were 6 of us) ended up throwing half of our orders out and to be honest after the awful customer service we had, I wouldn't try them again. Perhaps their drinks are better, but to be blunt, why bother going in when they're not even inviting?

b4ZseJGymqcUwRB5UN6oDw.review_text: The only thing going for the place is its beer selection.  Even that was tempered by the fact that they had their Guinness running off CO2 instead of nitrous.  The mac & cheese tasted like velveeta.  Just a big disappointment for me.

HOOuGraQ1cZOVbCDWBbk6A.review_text: love love. great burgers and great monday-wed drink deals. also, doesn't hurt that its right by work! giving 4 stars because its not the cleanest place in the world...

asL1d04xS3y8YQtU5ota-g.review_text: Staying around North Beach and Chinatown we've exhausted the normal touristy foodie places to eat. I was looking for something different and a local spot. So I found Grumpy's on Yelp. His place is in no man's land. Nothing around but business complexes. This is a local hangout and a true blue dive bar.   We got here about 11:30 and the place is empty. We got our choice table. At about 12:15 then all the local came pouring in. Very relaxing but tight seating.   I had the Chili Cheese Burger and fries. I read they had really good burgers here. Anyways, it's served open faced. Chili was homemade and was okay. Burger was just okay. Not a great meal. I guess I just didn't pick the right burger.   My daughter had the Manhattan Melt with ham, turkey, lettuce, tomato, cheese on a grilled sour dough bread. Outstanding. Really good. They give you four huge piece. She got the potato salad on the side with this. Really good. Outstanding. Had a little kick to it. Yum yum good.   My son had the meatloaf plate. Meatloaf was out of this world. Drop dead meatloaf. So good. Unbelievable. The homemade Mac & Cheese was okay. A little salty. The vegetables were so good and sweet. Outstanding dish.   My wife had the chicken Cesar salad. She really like it a lot. Very good  Anyways, service was very good. Water cups were filled in a regular basis. I accidentally spilled my water cup (can you say clumsy) and we had two waitresses cleaning it up right away. That's what I call good service.   So if your looking for a local spot away from all the touristy places. Somewhere out of the way but not that bad of an area then this is the place for you. Just be careful of what you order. Read the Yelp reviews first then order. Enjoy.

HL_FHh3CJxT2szBqsF7v_A.review_text: As others have said... the best burger I have found in the FiDi. Worth the walk. Juicy, delicious... my lunch destination any time my coworkers and I are feeling a burger... Haven't tried anything else here, and not sure why I would...

BwTPj8XS_iqdSTLPBVMs1w.review_text: Best dive burgers! Just get a regular cheeseburger and a pint of beer. You will not regret it!

yfq4INlwaC8dyX6tpwSqrw.review_text: Small spot with strong drinks!!  Indoor and outdoor seating (about 5 small tables inside), with a game always on.  They serve food to order as well.  Good place for a much needed strong drink after work.

kkAFJLviQ_dp1nChCvi3-Q.review_text: good ole Grumps! Hasn't done me too wrong as of yet- so I've gone to this place more times than i can count in the last 5 years- Breakfast: great. Lunch: yummy. Dinner: never been! This is a during the workday food/drink place- after hour drink specials... small place, nice peeps...they have awesome bacon!

96Wt_rBkOS1RUtB_7n1WaA.review_text: Just started school close by and brought a large crew over because I heard Grumpy's was good, but it was closed when we arrived at 9pm on a Tuesday. Not even a sign up. Am I missing something?

2ZCASyHp7_Y85DMb2-5ExA.review_text: Grumpy's is literally a block away from my work and when I don't feel like walking far, I end up picking up a burger or breakfast food based solely on convenience of their location.  The food is good, but is a bit overpriced.  Their prices have gone up quite a bit since I first stopped by and its odd because I've only been at my current job for about a year.  I can't really say that its great or awful.  It's a cool little hole in the wall spot and every time I've been there the service has been pretty good.  I have yet to go for Happy Hour, but I hear its good.  Maybe if I go for Happy Hour they'll get bumped up a star.  As for now, its decent food for the location, but I would never go out of my way to eat there.

NO36epYec7wWtzrgkPRnzw.review_text: Food- not bad. Location- close to work. Service-- terrible.   If you're on a 1-hr lunch, this is NOT the place for you!   I've been here lots of times because its close to my office, but today was the last time.  If you're not spending 20 minutes waiting for a seat, you're waiting 20 mintues for someone to take your order... now that lunch is half way over, its gonna be another 15-20 for your food to come out.   Yikes. At least if the average-at best food, added great service to a $30+ lunch for 2 bill, i might consider my return. :(

tERIXYhKVFn91F23z_w2bQ.review_text: Ate here today with my co-worker, and was pleasantly surprised.  Sat down at the bar because I enjoy bar seating during lunch, and ordered up a couple of burgers. We actually both got the Super, and ordered it "medium". I've got to say, i was AMAZED with the the fact my burger came out medium! not medium well, not well, not burnt...MEDIUM! enjoyed it thuroughly, the bartender was quick on the soda refills wihtout even asking.  My only gripe would be that the garlic fries aren't worth the extra $1.50.  They weren't bad, but it was more of a garlic oil than minced garlic and I prefer the minced.

yiZzbX1oUdsDhXfpL9p47g.review_text: Was in San Francisco with my sister for lunch. She couldn't find restaurant she had searched and we were using yelp for fish and chips close by.  Best fish and chips and macaroni and cheese I've tasted in awhile.  Best ginger ale too.  It was unusually hot in the city and it was nice to be in the cool pub.  Our server , Monica was so good as I like to try new places and ask lots of questions while I place my order.  I had leftovers for my long train ride home    Bonus is their bulldog mascot that looks like my Bentley 's Grandpa

AbC_IcLriK_cxl5OWO88dA.review_text: So I've just been here once so far but I know I'll be going back Its apparently the hangout spot for the ad agency crew on lunch. The burgers are really fantastic--all three that my table had were perfectly cooked and they offer really original toppings along with your standard favorites. They also have a good beer selection on tap. My one complaint was that it gets super crowded--including the outside seating which is a lovely treat actually--so you may have to wait for a table and the service can be a touch slow. But worth the wait. Or just make sure you go when you have at least an hour to sit and sip a beer while casually munching and talking.

_q_MC7ebjDOCpX5Ec7TXEQ.review_text: My first visit to Grumpy's was certainly a good one..I came on a lunch date and the conversation was good, but the food was even better! I ordered the tuna melt and my oh my...was it delicious!  My date said that the burgers there are always awesome, so i might have to try one of those next time...there's a nice bar inside, beers on tap, and small cozy sitting area right outside on the sidewalk. Perfect for a nice sunny day.   I would definitely come back to, as a matter of fact..i'm craving one of those tuna melts right now!

BRh5hZvTU-xYXux5WnjBMQ.review_text: This is a great place right near my office.  Looking for a good Happy Hour spot, this is perfect.  Specials on Tecate tall boys and the food is decent for a bar.  I'd not make this a destination, but the quality for convenience is worth the four stars.    I also dig that there's outdoor seating.  It's usually too cold, but if you want a smoke with your drink, it's pretty ideal!

EEBcB3Sm8LDASwBeu8UKsA.review_text: Their Super Burger might be the best burger I've ever had in a restaurant.  I asked for it medium rare, and it was a perfect pink all throughout.  Topped with delicous bacon and a fried egg (along with all the expected fixins), this was one of those lunches that had me grinning from the first bite until the last.

lxOcZ1VZ58nSCFgcunecjw.review_text: I've been to Grumpy's multiple times over the years and I enjoy it as it has good food, a good beer selection and it's kinda out in the middle of nowhere.  However, I went with my friend this past week and the service was really poor.  We got there relatively early and got our pick of where to sit since no one was there but we didn't get our meals until people that sat down next to us and arrived 20 minutes later than we did.  There was no apology or you know what we'll take care of your drinks.  And it wasn't like we ordered something difficult either.  So be careful next time you head to Grumpy's as you might have the same experience that I did.

bTFZ-cepM91pdS2PFpvJiA.review_text: Fun place near work - if you're at William Sonoma or Levi's plaza.  Bit of a gem for the area to be honest.  Chill atmosphere, food is moderately priced and they give you good portions.  The ONION RINGS ARE DELISH!!! What a pleasant surprise.  I was happy with the greek salad as well.. want to come for a beer and some onions rings after work sometime instead of just for lunch.  Probably not worth driving all the way down Battery to go to this place, but PERFECT for the work area since it's skimp on choices.. :)  Convenient outdoor seating even though the indoors is a fun atmosphere. I'm a fan indeed! :)

kdvOpupU89Nk2uFbIvQZzg.review_text: If you are in the financial, and need a spot for a pint that isn't crawling with DB's... go here. It is worth the walk, and the place is filled with a ton of people who work for the local news channels. They are friendly, and kind of like pirates in some weird way. It's off the beaten path, and has a sense of atmosphere. I recommend the Baja burger daily drink special. Only downside is they are not open on weekends, and you kind feel like you are far away when you get drunk enough to rally.

SapOcLmnu_E3WpCb0lYiKg.review_text: You could argue that Grumpy's is a three-star kind of joint, and I wouldn't fight you.  But for me, Grumpy's is easily four stars, for a number of reasons.  I've had many a wonderful, after-work happy hour here.  They have Stella on tap when I'm feeling light, Guinness on tap when I'm feeling dark.  It's not too loud to carry on a conversation with your friend or party, unlike Old Ship down the street.  When I've chanced to eat the food, it is very tasty.  For me, Grumpy's is the old standby - the comfy pair of pajamas that you want to put on at the end of a long day.  Ain't nothing wrong with that.

-0mCB5ap8xjsL9VuTv8E7Q.review_text: Grumpy's is an awesome lil bar with good drinks and delicious food. I'll often come here on my lunch break or right after work, and while they aren't open on weekends (sadness) they make me happy. Prices are fair, considering how great the food is. I usually get a cheeseburger because it's damn good.

44MbaaY9wYXK4uBKwqKIaw.review_text: Great food for a pub.  Loved the beer selection.  Service was good.  I got the Philly.  Only odd point was that the seem not to give many fries, but the portion was great anyway.

yW5ajGtDmMAujfld63J-eQ.review_text: this is the closest and most affordable restaurant thats close to my work.  its a small pub and always rather busy.  if you like  smaller crowd go around 11:30 or past 1.  they have a wide variety of burgers, fried deliciousness, sandwiches and beers.  they have speciality burgers and you can get beef, turkey or veggie so thats a good option.  so even though its got a lot of fried fatty deliciousness foods, you can still opt for a healthier option (although im not 100% sure why you would).  try the burger with the fried egg on top, its to die for.  anyway i probably go here twice a week for lunch at least so of course i think its above par.  or im that lazy...

1m4Hmm7IbgGjVupM7CQSMw.review_text: Of course we like to think that grumpys came around soley for the purpose of the ad execs to get wasted after work but it's got something for everyone. Drinks are cheap, burgers are tastey, bartenders are friendly but often get overwhelmed. This bar is located right off battery in the ad ghetto, so rival agencies meet up and mingle, The wall is adorned with signs from the nearby agencies so it really feels like "our local hangout." not a great place for wine but the beer selection is good.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: Another place I used to go to when I worked nearby. I loved the grumpy's. Really good breakfast! Really good Burgers! Club Sammys, Onion Rings, and Alcohol! haha. The staff was really friendly, we hung out and talked to them alot. I think the 2 guys are gone now :0( Well I left my dollar bill on the ceiling of Grumpys, when you go find it! It has my name on it :0)

9jLpJeKHWAjFTf_1rdyDMg.review_text: I went for a turkey burger(I'm trying to eat healthier) and the bartender said they were good but their hamburgers were really good, so I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and onion rings. Really good burger, onion rings were ok. I went back on my next trip to the city and got the turkey  burger and garlic fries. Tasty and juicy burger, garlic fries really good also. They have a few good beers on tap, several bottled beer and a full bar. They close at 10, so not a late night bar. It is a great place for a burger and a few beers.

yFn5TDFWfR6ERPzsMrGqJg.review_text: I've been to this place a few times and every time, I'm always pleased with the fact that the staff has your phone order ready when they say it will be ready and its always right.  There have been a few times I've given them a ton of names and details for other people and they do a good job in having it right.  Usually I get  salad with grilled salmon.  It's pretty basic with a vinaigrette and makes me wonder why in the hell I don't make it at home considering it's so simple.  But considering the salad is less than $10 and it's a decent size, it's good for when you didn't plan in advance.  I'm not a drinker but I did make an observation the last time I was there which was about 2 weeks ago.  They have Jegermeister on tap. lol  Pretty interesting, I'd say,

KofmcukQnRz9mjKOS0u66g.review_text: Went there on Thursday night- awesome food.  Great service at the bar, and good beer selection  Dropped down the rating as they are only open Monday-Friday... if they were open on weekends, easily 5 stars

cECtnYdL6BNfgeGLWOBpOw.review_text: Burgers and salads?  Why?  If any of you engage in this mockery of American culture, please explain your reasons to me.  I'm only taking off a star for the service.  Otherwise, the bacon cheeseburger with mushrooms has been known as a highlight of many a dark day at work.

KV3fdVjRa3JwOEW1LLXFdw.review_text: Such a loud place you can't even hear what your friends are telling you.  We had to constantly yelled at each other to keep the conversation going.  Burger was alright.  Nothing special.  French fries was so soggy and oily that I only had one.  And you can totally smell the oil from the fryer.  I definitely won't return.

0-1Mut3NrwRQy7SPcbEJHQ.review_text: This place rules over other Financial District places with an iron fist. They put pulled pork on a bun WITH coleslaw. Together on the same sandwich!  And let's settle something about Macaroni and Cheese. When you crave Mac and Cheese, what do you crave? Some fancy ass stuff with stuffed alfalfa sprigs and wine reduction glaze or do you crave that stuff in the blue box that momma used to make?  Get over yourselves San Francisco, and quit hating on Grumpy's Mac and Cheese. That shit is good. And if you're too good for it, then guess what, you're probably the kind of person who has an asymmetrical haircut,  listens to Fergie, and is excited about the Sex and the City movie, and you are therefore booooooring. Ironic, considering old school Mac and Cheese is so boring it's amazing.

2Qux0DdkrA9ZL-XEu4n6mQ.review_text: Great Burgers.....great drinks.....great atmosphere. I spend at least one day a week here getting wrecked. If you want to eat lunch...arrive no later than 11am....Or...wait until after 1:30. Too many suits.

6lw7nIa8aF7bJ60oRawEBQ.review_text: Great place to go for lunch break. Cool pub, plus good burgers.

KgDOK0iFpD2mQsKkpvrALg.review_text: The designated burger joint for "Advertising Row".  Hawaiin shirt adorning creatives, cracked out account executives, and party hardy media teams all gather into Grumpy's for beers and one of the best burgers in the hood.  You literally rub elbows with some interesting people here.  Cramped tables add to the intimate setting.  Lots of dollar bills are strangely stuck to the ceiling... perhaps some creative briefs too!    Get the turkey burger.  Just get it.  It's worth the 30 min prep time!  Your conference call to NY and Redmond can wait.  Filling your belly with a ketchup smothered turkey burger with fries is more rewarding than budgeting $50 mill worth of billings.

D3zzBdZDs4qH3sChk3k9_Q.review_text: GRUMPY'S!!! This place is great! Best dive bar around for sure. They have good happy hours and considering it's a darker, noisy dive bar, it's clean, the staff is friendly and they have a huge selection of food - and it's really good at that! It's one of our favorite lunchtime spots and we'll definitely be back.

I-YFZfhjHOF5LkjvGBrerQ.review_text: First off the service is slow as hell, forget going at lunch the place is packed and you won't get in. The beer and turkey burger is good. The place is small so you often end up sitting too close to strangers. Did I mention how slow the service is? yeah slow. Oh and it's loud, but there is a fun ambiance to it, would be so much better if they expanded.

hQ8To_s10kfhi2rc4js5cg.review_text: Dear Cook at Grumpy's: Screw you for doing such a piss poor job of making my garlic fries.

bN-QNxRGzx6VeWOgcCnekQ.review_text: So, one of my business partners and I landed a contract that was about two blocks from this joint and remarkably, there just isn't that many "go-to's" for lunch in that area (Green Street and Embarcadero) The Ferry Building got old, Piperade was just a bit too "la-dee-da" for a quick lunch. Between this, Old Ship and RJ's Market (which is pretty good) we found ourselves polarized by the convenience of Grumpys. So that said, my ramble below pertains only to lunch experiences.  So, once you get your head and belly into a "sandwiches, burgers and salads" type of mindset, the place delivers. To date, I've stayed on the middle-of-the-road path with the menu (classic cheeseburgers with fries or a side salad, grilled chix sandwiches, tuna melts,  cobb salads, beet salads, etc.) and ALL of that grub was prepped and served up really well. Proteins were fired to perfection at the right temps, fries were crisp and soft on the inside with great seasoning, salads were big and put together with a mix of toppings and textures to make even something so basic, still delish. You actually catch yourself thinking, "wow, the food here is pretty damn good."  AND...mind you, I haven't even tried any of the Signature Burgers (15+ gourmet burger types from the Baja to the Popeye), the chicken parm, the turkey plate, other fancier salads or any of the bar-food apps. SO, I can only imagine this place gets better and better. The bartender was talking me into the chili-cheese fries, which are supposed to be damned good, but I was already two beers down and needed to head out for a meeting.  Which brings me to booze, staff and ambiance. Booze: great beers on tap and affordable hard liquor bevvies and happy hour specials. Great place for liquid lunches - ding ding ding.  Staff: Welcoming and friendly, just as we all like. In the mad rush, they can get a bit busy so sometimes it can feel a little slow (in the kitchen or front of house) but they keep up for the most part and do it with coolness, kindness and smiles. Ambiance: Hell, it's a pub/barfood joint. If you're looking for tablecloths and a sommelier then you might keep on steppin'. BUT, if a pile of kegs in the corner, a bunch of tables crammed edge to edge, Sportscenter on on the TVs, Foo Fighters (yes Dave Grohl gets loud when they come on in there for some reason) rockin' in the background and great food at a great price...go get you some Grumpys.   And, if you figure out what the hell the bulldog with the fern leaf logo is all about, you win free Grumpys for life. Just kidding. I just want to know what the backstory is on that.   Cheers.

F2_vU0hLpKMYhZG8X0Fztw.review_text: I LOVE GRUMPY'S! I have many fond memories of drinking beers and eating delicious greasy pub food. Grumpy's fries are the BEST. They started serving different fries for a while after management changed but I think the change was short-lived. My favorite meal here is the tuna melt with fries and a pint of Bass, or two. ::drool::

8SqBkk4ol6Z9OpM1jqnLaA.review_text: I try...REALLY hard not to make fun of other people's reviews...OK I don't try hard...actually I don't try at all...but I don't think I've read a bigger collection of wussbag reviews than for this place.  First of all, to the people who think prices here are expensive need to loosen up a bit on their money purses.  It's in San Francisco; you go to a place that hugs the North Beach - Financial district border, what do you expect?  Seriously, you frugal fairies, bony bastards, parsimonious pieces of shit...how many items do you see here over $10  Second of all, waiters wait and bartender are bartend.  Do I see Dr. Phil or Silvia Browne in here? No!  They can't read your mind nor predict your thinking and thank God, cuz no one really wants to know what the hell goes on inside that stupid little head of yours.  If you received the wrong order or if your order took longer, ASK (politely) and they - like any good barstaff - will get it right.  It's OK to ask the bartender how much longer your food will take or send your food back for the right order.  They thrive on word of mouth and much rather you leave happy than you leave unsatisfied...DUH...Stop sitting there pissed off and arguing with the world with your eyes and posture, no one likes that shit you wuss.    My friend and I came here on a Wednesday night and imbibed in that night's specials - $7 shot and beer, $1 garlic fries...oh garsh, almost broke my piggy bank!!  We got fish and chips and a burger.  The large portions helped pad the stomach for the beers we ordered.  The bartender was overworked - he ran the bar and restaurant orders by himself and didn't shower us with attention - boohoo.  Each step of the way I needed to ask for attention - "I'd like to order drinks please," "Can we order food?" "We'll take the check now"...how difficult was that??!?!?  He was nice about it, told some jokes, interacted with us and harassed us to come back and visit.  The bill?  A mind blowing $24...  An interesting mix of crowd (at least when we went) - financial district people, loud bridge and tunnel dudes, a softball team and a group of three chicks that could make Stevie Wonder cry.  It's a homey place - felt (and looked) a bit like Paddy's Pub from It's Always Sunny In Philadelphia.  I like the vibe here, I definitely felt at ease here and would come back for happy hour.  Signs on the walls, dollar bills pinned to the ceiling and funny lookin' chicks create a homey vibe with a tinge of amusement.  The Jaeger keg however, reminds you it's still a legit drinking establishment.

-PoCbyNa4xc4yvReuj5pqw.review_text: Food: Happy Hour Garlic Fries $1.00, zucchini sticks with fries and a bacon burger with potato salad (the bartender asked me if I wanted fries with that, hope he was joking...)  Drinks: Happy Hour $7.00 beer and a shot.  Food and drinks get a solid 4 stars, service gets 3, bathroom gets 3, awesome name and non douchey crowd gets 5 stars.

BvRgHbtpDbmP0pCOJ-fbjg.review_text: Hands down, the best burgers in the financial district area

5c0kFVG6-Q0TwBT2yd1U9A.review_text: My friend(s) and I usually do a liquid lunch once a week or so and we decided to try Grumpy's Pub today.  It was a little bit of a trek but well worth it.  Our standard is basically the Royal Exchange which is pretty good with a solid beer selection and decent food.  In my mind RE is three stars, which is average, so my review will be in comparison to that.  The beer selection at Grumpy's was not as expansive as RE's but they definitely had a good selection (Anchor, Lagunitas IPA, Dos Equis, Hef, etc.) so for me Grumpy's held par.  The place is much smaller and had quite the lunch rush, but we still were able to walk right in at 1 pm on Friday and get seated. Our order was taken promptly enoug and our beers came out ahead of our meal.  I got a burger, medium rare, and my friend got a "Manhattan" which was kind of like a club sandwich.  He reported that it was good. My burger was also very good. Perfectly sized in that I could have eaten more but didn't need to.  The cheese was quality aged chedder and the bacon was perfectly cooked.  The fries were also good (I would have wanted more on the plate, but didn't NEED more).  The burger and sandwich were about $10/each.  Beers were $5/pint.  I was able to get my meal, two beers and out in about an hour which is the perfect time.  The place is kind of loud but it was busy and not to the point we were annoyed.  Grumpy's is a little out of the way, but worth the walk on a nice day. It's about 10 minutes from the Financial District.  If I was in between RE and Grumpy's, I would probably choose Grumpy's 80% of the time. Definitely worth a stop as they have many other choices on the menu, all of which looked good.

vgwdQ0fpDZdoTidJuwYq7w.review_text: Not sure what that one Yelper was smoking, but this place is NOT a dive by any standard. The damn barstaff wear button down shirts and there is a lot of light, corporate logos on the (clean) walls, and a kitchen that serves more than just burgers. Since we were in the area and it's the only bar we saw we popped in for a couple rounds, which were priced well and strong enough. The first bartender did not have a button down shirt and he was friendly and offered good advice on booze when they ran out of what we had the first round. I'd go back if I was over that way.

xyNdK7m0i1Y4pb4gJicA6g.review_text: Great American food, hearty portions, and good selection of beer. Nice servers and cute bartenders, friendly vibe all around. Depending on which you order, food can run a little steep. Service can be agonizingly slow, especially during lunch. Fills up real fast. But worth the wait.

jpMJ8RifYA9iv6_K7WWa8g.review_text: ask Kevin the bartender if you can see the prisoners chained up in the cellar....it's cool!  UPDATE: Kevin is gone but Josh my man, you are a honorable replacement.   they serve burgers here?

hpffQUMlFzNVFddmmx1RUQ.review_text: Grumpy's has absolutely everything you could ask for in an after-work watering hole: good food (their new addition of buffalo chicken strips was a stellar idea), happy hour specials, televisions playing sports, weirdo employees from Second Life, the occasional hot cougar, and a friendly bar staff that will remember you if you're there enough.  The relative lack of traffic on Vallejo Street is nice because on crowded, sunny days the clientele can spill out into the street. The jalapeno poppers and the baja burger are highly recommended.   Go there for lunch or go there for happy hour. Hell, you can even go there for breakfast because the bloody mary is pretty legit too.

nlOxarS20luHkAloH5YyzA.review_text: Killer man!  This place totally rocks.  So many choices of burgers and beers.  And it's off the beaten path of the financial district, so it's not totally busy during the week.  I guess it can get a little busy during lunch, but it's lunch time, so expect it.  Duh!  Nevertheless, mmm, makes me want a burger right now.

U13tLFucJNz1fNv_Xgdj0g.review_text: DELICIOUS.  Oh man, this place is good.  I went with a friend of mine for lunch, and I ordered just the cheeseburger w/fries, and it was perfectly cooked, and very savory.  I also liked the vibe of this place during the work week -- a relaxing, yet upbeat place to grab a bite for lunch.  You can also see the Bay Bridge when you're walking in and the location is very convenient.  Dug it!

HPJY5cQ7Za6Hi07eB3gvZA.review_text: Paper money pinned to ceiling, small and intimate restaurant and bar and good service. A girlfriend and I came here before a holiday gathering and everything was pretty good. There were specials, beer on tap and a decent amount of liquor to choose from. A cool spot tucked away from the rush of The Embarcadero.

t7wdIt-oG2M2VxD-a1miPQ.review_text: Favorite burgers in town, if it's your first time, try the Baja or better : the super The others are good too but these two are the best. They accept to split the burgers in half as well which is great if your stomach is small :)

zTE8KUu2ukFQZ67fZypLtA.review_text: i live a few blocks away from this place.  for the longest time i had no idea there was a restaurant/pub right there because it's located in the no-man's land between the FiDi and the touristy fisherman's wharf area.  surprise... when i walked by one time in the evening to see that there was a bit of a crowd hanging outside this place.  seems like there's a bit of a hidden gem that only the locals knew about?  I finally get a chance to go to grumpy's the other day for happy hour and dinner and as expected, there's a crowd standing outside, each man with a glass of beer in hand.  inside was a little crowded but my friends and i were able to get a table.  we sit for a while, and realize that we're supposed to order our food at the bar.  (is that right, folks?  geez, i hope that's true.  if it's not, then i wonder how long it would have taken before an waiter served us.)  for the record, at least in my experience, you're supposed to order your food at the bar.    i ordered a lagunitas IPA and a reuben burger.  the bartender was a really nice and friendly guy but forgot to ask me how i liked my burger done.  at least the food came out fast, and it was delish.    grumpy's has a pretty decent selection of beer on tap (lagunitas IPA, anchor steam, anchor porter, guiness, stella, widmer, trumer, sierra nevada, spaten lager, fat tire... ) and happy hour is $4, which is OK.  They also have other happy hour specials, such as $4 margarita thursdays.    my friends have tried and liked the baja burger and the california burger.  i hear the fish and chips are alright but you can get better elsewhere.   the crowd looks like there were quite a few regulars, most likely the after-work crowd from the neighboring offices and the bartenders seem really friendly and cool.  the quality of service doesn't seem to be their forte but sometimes i'm ok with that, as long as they're not straight up rude.  i could see myself being a regular here... maybe.  it's alright.

oW2bCSJ5bIHyRnoZvkHwDg.review_text: Have a business lunch where no one is really interested in eating lunch but everyone talks about lunch and then pass around a couple menus and you pick one together that is totally arbitrary but will deliver some overpriced food you can expense?  This is one of those places.  Just fine.  does the job.

pRZw2ZXFEWiC_mkCX7JaBA.review_text: Really decent bar food in a dive-y, but not too dive-y, bar filled with locals.  Kevin the bartender is super adorable!

wPu-IJdZMEbFVEFSXflIAg.review_text: Best turkey burger ever.  Go early and go hungry!  I crave their burgers in the morning and always relish eating the Western. Mmm!  So good.  For a burger, usually runs you about $12 a person.

RLWwM7aInJxNoOPKuvAevA.review_text: I'm the type of guy that thinks the quality of service is just as important as the quality/taste of the food. I came in for lunch today with my buddy and the place was packed. And for is busy as it was i didn't expect the service to be so good. A+ for service!! I had the cheeseburger and the garlic fries. Fries were good but a bit on the soggy side.  As for the burger, it was a good burger...nothing great but good. I was checking out other customers plates and they looked pretty tasty. I'll go for something different next time.

7e4CioqxGMByqh0lJP5FZg.review_text: Good burgers - actually, really good burgers. Service is spotty but friendly when you get their attention.

f9GMVuLrrm6ggcIvlhXbdA.review_text: Like dive bars. Like to find places where there're no tourists even though I'm  one. This fit perfectly. Great western burger, great atmosphere, great bartender who warned me that jalapeño poppers and a burger may be too much food. (He was right). Upgraded to garlic fires - well worth it. The bartender was the best. Will definitely relax a night here when I'm back in town.

_E8fCCrB9T4wZnX8CsS75A.review_text: This place is near my work so I come here a lot of happy hour. I come here usually for the $5 draft beer and $1 garlic fries...$1 GARLIC FRIES! really good, but super greasy!   it says you have to spend over $20 to pay with card, but the bartender doesn't care so you can use your card for a lesser amount.

iZXxYbfjkFn4Ffu40bEHcQ.review_text: Like most places in the Levi's Plaza area - this is not a weekend spot. Nor is this a spot that you go to past 8 on a weekday. It is solely for business hours and work happy hours. That being said - this is a great bar to come for a drink with coworkers after 5. They also have great take out for lunch - great burgers and fries along with your typical fried bar fare. It's a little pricey for what you get, but hey - its Levi's Plaza - not too many other options around.

_VGIPT2dDMJvAsRjjQcD-A.review_text: The burgers here are outrageous...outrageously juicy!!...The juices were dripping off of the burgers to the point where I can't tell which is the grease or the au jus...My friends swear to this place...the fries were first rate.  Also try out their many choices of booze...I favor the light Anchor steam...(friends call me a wuss for going "light", but I gotta watch the calories!!!)  Also try out their breakfast grub...they make a mean mushroom/veggie omelette...I don't happen to like their potato hash..they were chunks of potatoes with no flavoring. Kinda bland.  The toast they offer is usually saturated with buttery goodness, so watch out!  Parking is a pain here, there's tons of meters, and lots of overpriced lots...Best bet on a weekday, just take Muni and walk along the Embarcadero.

Byn9gsZ2kS_yOnsfUQiYzw.review_text: There's nothing fancy about this place and that is part of what makes it such a find. Since we moved our office to the neighborhood last year I'm eating at Grumpy's a whole lot more often than I should! The burgers are off the chart and the bar is second to none. It is your dream of what a cool, low-key neighborhood pub is supposed to be.

AmHsNg3SolCitjrRAcYYaQ.review_text: I haven't been here yet but word is that it's "Dirty Jobs" host Mike Rowe's favorite bar in the city.  I'll check it out just to have the chance to run into him!

p9OUxMKlyRkOueYAeHuXig.review_text: lunch with co workers after watching d Giants parade. the crowd hasn't arrived so we got good seats.  we ordered burgers and drinks.  I got mushroom Brie burger with fries= good. burger was cooked perfect.  service... slow. d servers and the kitchen were backed up with pick up orders that they kept  their seated customer waiting for at least 30 mins. I think a good restaurant management should plan to make sure that this doesn't happen.

e1FuiYSV1v29q2OTR9ojBA.review_text: Thank you Grumpy's, for satiating my bleu cheese burger craving at lunch today.  Next time, though, when I ask for it "medium well", can you make sure it's not pink in the middle?  Kthxbye!  (PS. They seem to have a pretty nice happy hour going on here....$4 margaritas till closing?  Mmmmmmm!!)

3rBR1WbqpYm4c4FrnDlOKA.review_text: Hidden area of the Financial District - The BEST burgers I've ever had. My favorite is the "California" which includes Monterey jack cheese, bacon, ortega chile & sour cream. It comes with either french fries, potato salad or mixed green salad. The mixed salad is fresh and comes in a big portion and the fries are crispy and so GOOD! Also, this is a cool place to go for happy hour. Not too much of a selection but they have good appetizers & beer.  Only open M-F from 8am - 10pm but sometimes they close early if it's slow.

6NKZzw6lwdAji-Sc2l9w4g.review_text: Local pub local to my office near Levis Plaza on Battery.  Great location, quiet street setting. They have very good service, even when it's packed, great burgers, a wide selection of beers and just all around fun place to hang during lunch or after work.

DLrptiHwqa0JLYFJsp4vzg.review_text: Any burger that requires three napkins to finish is a good burger in my book... then there's that whole idea of Guiness with lunch. Now I need a nap. When I'm done with that, I'll be back for some buffalo wings.. ..

AlBoilRiKVTW9B0qr6wt6w.review_text: Tasty burger and a decent beer selection (including one British ale, always a good sign as an ex-pat!).  One star knocked off for a soggy burger bun.

ZeYj7JqE_4gcXQEyaEalQg.review_text: My hat is off at Grumpy's! This place is legit, great food, oh my god, great food. The burger here is damn good. If this is your first visit go Burger or Cheeseburger medium rare and dont even look back. The juice coming out of their burgers is exactly the way a burger should be, juicy! The meat to bun ratio favors the meat, a huge plus. Great fries, free refills on your sodas when your just trying for business in the front, but god forbid you ruffle the party in the back for a drink special Monday - Friday like a $7 beer and a Jameson shot, which kick starts my mullet. The food menu is great pub food, burgers, grilled sandwiches, god if you like BLT's, who doesnt, its awesome. They have TV's on the wall for you viewing pleasure and a fun comfortable atmosphere. May I recommend you get here before 11:45AM, as any financial district favorite goes, this one is BUTT SLAMMED for M-F lunch. Dont be afraid to call in your order and take this set up back to your desk, leave the leftover Lasagna at home!

XDgKe98qTvxuHNuwUVLwNA.review_text: This was my first visit to Grumpy's and I do believe I will be a patron of this establishment once more because I liked it and the food was good.  I tried their Turkey Pastrami Ruben with a side of shoestring fries (to which I am told is not the normal fry type, steak fry is the normal selection).  The bread was well toasted, but the kraut and pastrami 'juice' made it a little soggy.  The turkey pastrami and kraut were very good and I will be having that sandwich again.  The atmosphere is fitting as a pub, with mystery dollars tacked to the ceiling.  Some of the dollars are intricately placed and folded causing me to wonder how the dollars are placed there along with the obvious why.

yOSlEtwWOW_gklOWmUOsNQ.review_text: Was disappointed to learn that the prices and specials advertised on their website are very outdated (writing this review a month later so they had time to update it - hasn't happened yet). No more $4 drafts/margaritas at happy hour... how about $8 for a can of PBR and a shot? To be fair, those prices seemed a little too good to be true for this area.  Food-wise, the burgers were amazing, but the garlic fries were icky. Wet and creamy instead of crisp and aromatic.   Overall, if you're looking for an affordable dive, I don't think this place qualifies. But if you are in the mood for a tasty burger, definitely check it out.

6Dc89_MPk-FBhiImUOkSPQ.review_text: After my last visit, I don't think I'll be going back. I went in to order some food to go. I knew what I wanted, but it was extremely difficult to get the bartender's attention. When he finally asked and I said I wanted to order food, he stopped me and said, "then hold on" and proceeded to serve customers behind me. Didn't offer me a menu or an excuse. Even the customers behind me said, "but the young lady was in front!" The bartender said, "that's fine" and proceeded to take their orders first. I ordered fish & chips and got a non-itemized bill for $11.91 (menu price is $7.95). Even with taxes, that seems excessive, but at that point, I just wanted to be out of there, so I didn't argue, just paid and left.  Also, don't even bother deciding on a salad. The menu lists 12 salads, but every time I tried to order a salad other than Caesar or Chef's, I was told they don't have it.

cmK5ubZx4jmyJYhdK2qw2A.review_text: its small & its a bit out of the way but the bartenders kick ass as does the bar food!

QtuP5qUpJ0JX_O8A_64k0g.review_text: Awesome hole in the wall pub!  Randomly stumbled upon this place on yelp and decided to come here for dinner, after discovering Sushirrito closed after lunch.. It was packed, but we were quickly seated.   There was only one person working taking care of drinks at the bar, taking orders, and bringing out food, and he still came by promptly to bring us all ice water and take our orders. Our food came out relatively quickly too. Service was superb!  The food was delicious too. I got the cheeseburger with the fried egg and it was cooked perfectly. Definitely hit the spot after a long day of roaming SF.  The interior is pretty small and very dark - a typical pub-like feel. There are a bunch of bills stuck on the ceiling and the tables are in a tight arrangement. Felt a little dingy, but what pub doesn't?  All in all, great find and not to mention it's a short walking distance from the pier! Took a nice stroll afterwards to walk off our meal and got to see the gorgeous bay bridge in all its lit up glory. Definitely should give this place a try!

yBByHjBmvXVWOJVR5HWjcg.review_text: Not that I'd expect anything different from a pub/grungy bar... but holy cow were those burgers greasy! Were they good? Yes! But after finishing off an entire western bacon cheeseburger and onion rings (I was hungry...), I've been full for the last 12 hours. No joke. It's a heart attack on a plate.
