Specialty burgers are $10.50 + extra if you want onion rings.   The services leaves much to be wanted. The tables are gross. The place is a bit of a hole in the wall, but the place seemed busy and popular so the crowds can't be wrong, right?  The food is good, but i wouldn't call it the best bar food i've ever had. The onion rings were again good but not great. i'd come back again if a friend wanted to go but I wouldn't come back on my own. Given the ambience and the sopping wet hamburger bun (From absorbing all that grease! I am telling you!), I deduct another star from what I would call a fun but mediocre place for food.

TOj5yZZEwS3J3fLgo3V3yQ.review_text: This place is alright with me. I met some friends there. they said it was their version of Cheers. And everyone did know their names.  They were celebrating one of their co-workers last day or something. They cracked me up with the story of how she didn't even order a drink and left. I ****finally**** got one of the best margaritas I've ever had. But apparently, it was too late to order any additional food. So I picked at cold french fries and rubber band calamari that was left on the group plates. They said the burgers were good there. I'll never know.   The restroom was slightly scary. There was enough tissue and soap and towels. But the logistics were scary. Does this door lock? Does it stay locked?   All in all, it was a fair experience. I was not spending the night there. I was just grabbing a quick drink after work. So it's alright with me for that...

kZOiwf44brbn-2CtOktBEg.review_text: Friend : dude she's not your type. She has really short hair and sorta ehhhh looking. Me : I know but she's different and somewhat cute. It's not the jameson talking either. It's the inner beauty we should be looking for right? We all get the old bro. Friend: shut up, drink some more and stick with your cougars  I usually dont go to bars like this. the crowd is generally older, loud, divey and small. But check this out, they were showing some old school break dancing moves on the flat screen and sometimes a cult movie is on. dollar bills on the ceiling? what the heck? kevin the bartender is extremely friendly and remembers multiple drinks with changes on the fly. it does get really busy and most of the time its either and one or two man show. burgers are juicy and cooked like the way you want them at home. and can i custom order crazy stuff? how about garlic onion rings, and garlic fries with bacon! dayam....... imma be buzzed and my breath smell? no clubbing fo rme tonight. this place might look a little weird but has great character. and thats what all "i" should be looking for.

oZHcTvwGnhMqH7ZSNUEtSw.review_text: I will probably never give out 5 stars, kinda like Michelin being so stingy with the 3 star rating. I just feel like five stars is kinda unattainable, you would have to have a world class chef and a bartender serving only you. That said, the fact that Grumpy's, with the grill guy chefs and emo bartenders, earns four stars is saying something. I work at a construction site right around the corner and my food is usually ready at 12 which is a plus because I get a half hour for lunch. I always order the Super cause, well, it's super. Fried egg and bacon on a burger? MMMMmmmmm!  Good atmosphere for afternoon drinking too. We took over the bar with 10 plumbers one day before Christmas, it was great times.

eQJtcM6rK0-x2F2UlZaNJg.review_text: I run by this place all the time and always want to stop and check it out.  I went yesterday after work and had a great experience.  $6 for a pint of Anchor and shot of Jameson!  I hear the food is great and they have plenty of flat screens showing sports.  Outdoor seating to boot.  Next time I go running, I'm bringing some cash.

my36mJlxoSwNoA_rgLkLAQ.review_text: I like this quaint little pub! Perfect spot to grab a beer, drinks fries and fun! I like coming here with the co-workers to share great conversation. They have happy hour specials!

92z73FpgQ3lAZY0nrHP1qg.review_text: Too many chances...  Food is overpriced at this wanna-be pub.  Wishing it was in a busier London district rather than a San Francisco outskirt, Grumpy's Pub is the kind of place you can go pay DOUBLE DIGITS for a burger and still feel like you could have just eaten the cow on the farm and saved a bit of cash.    Food is horrible here.  WORST!!!  Service is awful.  One time I ordered a  Rueben without the Turkey, and they took out EVERYTHING.  Thanks Grumpy's for the two slices of stale rye and the luke warm red meat.  Can I at least get some sauerkraut, cheese, and if it's not too much trouble, some MUSTARD???  "Not enough mustard" has more than one meaning here, believe me.  How's about some breakfast?  Not after 11:30?  Have you ever been to an English Pub?  It doesn't matter what time it is, they make eggs all day!  Plus, if someone wants an egg sandwich at 3 in the afternoon, don't say you can't do it because you're too busy.  If you are too busy to make two eggs on bread with cheese, then you must not be able to handle ANY OTHER ORDERS!!!  Get your $#!T together or close down shop so something better can move in.   Bah I SAY!!  BAH!!!!

syeYjOT3nGDBvafefgFsZw.review_text: Grumpy's serves as the meeting place for the non-suited maritime industry at my work.  Usually after a Board meeting, much like agendized issues, there will be a split between the pilots and industry; the industry head to table-clothed diners such as Tadich Grill and Piperade while the pilots head to Grumpy's.  Coming here, I now know why.  Placing the batsignal to prison fodder Hueyn/Mindy, we arrived to a packed bar.  Grumpy's is a very small area and on the initial scan, this place reminded me of the mythical Tortuga.  At the bar, you see full-blossomed strumpets laughing at every joke of their consorts, vying for attention and hopefully, another drink, slyly letting their robust chest touch said man's arm from time to time.  Ahhh..the power of female wiles.  Basically, for you Davis alumni, this is Cantinas del Cabo in the daytime.  The manager was very gracious despite the crowd and rush of orders, ushered us to our table in a timely fashion.  I ordered the Baja burger while Mindy ordered the Western burger.  Our waitress was brisk and curt, understandable with the lack of manpower here, and could not engage in banter.  My gripe with this place is that the food took forever which seems to be a reoccurring theme among it's clients.  The problem with this is two fold: 1.  one gets extremely hungry 2.  most importantly, if your company is with somebody similar to Huyen/Mindy and his stories of getting turned out in prison become trite and downright sick, the conversation becomes rather stale and there is only so many people you can text or pretend to check time.  jk jk  The burgers finally came out and by that time, I was too famished to really enjoy the burger.  This burger, similar to the Old Ship, is more of a bar burger.  There is nothing gourmet about it.  It drips grease and the bun becomes soaked quickly.  I prefer my buns toasted. The patty was large but devoid of any robust flavour.  I found the picca de gallo to be underwhelming...the salsa wasn't distinct.  There was a minimal amount of seasoning...again..this is just your salt and peppered'd hamburger patty.  This is not your 7x7 Top Burgers that cost $15-20.  The fries were your traditional American salted fries..soggy but with ketchup and ranch, the perfect complement to a meal.  The bacon was thick and bountiful and the bottom line was that it was food for the soul, good to coat the lining of your stomach for an impending le twist adventure.  You will come to Grumpy's leaving without its namesake emotion.  The burgers are old fashioned and simple and takes me to a childhood when I did not know of finer things in life such as brie, fried egg, goat cheese condiments.  Sometimes it is better that one does not know.  They also have a $7 special during happy hour consisting of a shot of jamison and a brewski.  Drinks to the most delectable cutlet at the bar...wadDUUP.

m3PY8eFg_kMe9nbEJrpWWA.review_text: We frequent this neighborhood spot for happy hour.  They have great appetizers and good beer.  What more could you ask for?  oh yeah, good prices and happy, buzzed friends all around.  Breakfast: try their egg & cheese sandwich....the last time I had it it comes with country potatoes and is only $3.50!  For lunch I like their turkey burgers...YUM!

77K9EhqsZrnqmsNKKwqkrg.review_text: I've walked past this pub a number of times on my way to the new Exploratorium. I happened to be hungry this past week and decided to stop by to grab a burger. The other reviews do not lie. The burger with a fried egg and bacon was one of the tastiest burgers I've ever had. I asked for medium rare, and it came out exactly as ordered. The beef patty was seasoned perfectly as well, you can still taste the meat. I have plans to come back to try their other Signature burgers at $12 a burger.   Side note, the fries it came with were also very crispy. I opted for the garlic fries, and they definitely have a kick.

3lWC0riFiQmnchl1BYZYKg.review_text: My review is for their lunch, I have not had the opportunity to check out their Happy Hour yet.  I came in on a friday just after noon and was immediately able to sit down.  Service was really quick and the servers were very friendly.   I got the French Burger with a side of garlic fries.  $10.50 seems a lot for a burger but I was surprised on how big this burger was.  I will definietly be making two meals out of it.  When I got the bill, there was a $1.50 difference between the check and the subtotal so I asked the waiter and he explained that the Garlic Fries are extra so be forewarned when the waiter is going through the available sides for the burgers that Garlic Fries and Onion Rings are an additional charge.  I would recommend adding that line underneath the available sides so they don't get anyone upset in the future over hidden charges.  But overall, it was a great meal.  If the prices were a little cheaper I would have given it 5 stars but hey, this is San Francisco, and the place seems to be pretty popular.  I just wish it were open during the weekends.

qthtyjV-1dHIApNHtWB40A.review_text: I work right around the corner from Grumpy's and never even knew it existed! This place is a total dive, but somehow draws the pretentious crowds of the nearby advertising agencies, which I will have to admit, I am part of. I am excited to go back to Grumpy's for an after work beer with the co-workers or another lunch.  The place was packed, but somehow we got the last table for the six of us and didn't have to wait at all. All of the guys ordered hamburgers and my female co-worker and I both ordered salads...go figure. The hamburgers looked delicious as long as you don't get it well done or as it states on the wall, "like shoe leather." I got the Summer salad, which was really good and had chicken, feta, mango, avocado, tomatoes & garbanzo beans on it. You can order each of the hamburgers replaced with chicken if desired or you can choose any of the many other sandwiches on the menu. They also have various types of appetizers, fried chicken, and macaroni & cheese on the menu that sound great!  The service was pretty good, not great and the wait staff was friendly enough. I will definitely make the short trip back to Gumpy's soon...maybe even tomorrow!

ghRwENzjazf5b94m5ga5NQ.review_text: They have a cool bartender called Mary.  She serves the best pint of Boddington's around!  Greasy bar food + shots of Fernet on special = a perfect Friday Happy Hour.

OphDzZtaiDs5grWP-Enjpg.review_text: When I call in a lunch order of 5 burgers,   and you tell me that they'll be ready in 20 minutes,   and I arrive in 20 minutes,   and you tell me that it'll just be 5 more minutes,  and the 5 minutes turns into 20 minutes,  and then you finally produce my order,   and then when I get back to the office I discover that 3 of the burgers were made wrong --  -- don't expect more than 3 stars.

wvz6uXRByI_TQ2YgYGAllQ.review_text: The food is decent. Good for drinks during and after work. Nice because it is close to work. The service is excellent, though! You should also ask them to make the publicis lion roar! Burgers are a little pricey for just burgers, but they are pretty yummy.

PvBmRN4suldo06Kcz2-vcw.review_text: burgers ok, chicken burger always over done.  and their coke is always watered down and just doesn't work.  never fixed.

YSDhmkxZ84eIzaG-5Z6jBg.review_text: Can't tell you how many times I went here for lunch during work, then got wasted on bloody marys. Love the burgers (any can be made into a turkey burger) and love the drinks. Can be hard to find a table, but if you're in the area, well-worth the wait. Stay away from the Jaeger though...

F6bOroEwVX0t2Z0jvH4miA.review_text: Even with the wait and lack of tables, Grumpy's food has me salivating long before the lunch hour.  Their burgers are what burgers should be: thick, juicy, and full of flavor.  The burgers also come in many different styles - Popeye (with spinach and feta); Mushroom-Brie; etc.  Their onion rings are amazing, fresh, crunchy, and full of flavor.  Lots of good beer on tap (Fat Tire, Guiness, etc.) and they do serve other items if you aren't feeling burgers that day - fish; patty melts; chicken tenders and the like.  The only "grr" about the place is the wait, but with the food served, it is no wonder.  Key point to Grumpy's if you have a big group - send someone over ahead of time to hold a table, calling doesn't help.

r11Z9_0HZulh9JRqI6WKWg.review_text: Grumpy's is a kick-ass hole in the wall sorta pub.  They've got about 6-8 beers on tap and a nice selection of liquor.  The burgers and fries are solid drunk bar food and go well with a pint or 12- just keep in mind, it's a pub, not whatever gourmet place some people seem to exclusively eat at.  They have booze, the prices are reasonable, happy hours are entertaining (Thursday $4 margaritas, M-W is beer and a shot, F is $3 tall boy tecates) and the bartenders are superfriendly.  Well, at least they are to me because I have fun with them.  Sean, Mary and Kevin rule- mostly at destroying my liver with love.  There's usually a decent crowd in the mid-afternoon and it stays pretty busy until about 8 or 9, when most of the passersby head off to north beach since most everything else in the area shuts down by 10.  The crowd is mostly younger, but still an interesting mix of people.  It's almost undoubtedly the most laid-back, unassuming place to grab a drink.    If you want a place to chill after a lame day at work, this is it.  All the Paddy's/Cheers references are spot-on.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: My memory is better than I thought. I went to Grumpy's for the first time a few years back and remembered it as having a good burger. But this was before yelp, so I never had any place to record those thoughts for the world to see (and for me to use as a reference point years down the road). So I wasn't sure.  After returning for a second time, I can yelp with complete confidence it is indeed a great spot. Plenty of beef-turkey-chicken options, super friendly/quick service, and fries or a salad on the side. My turkey burger was delicious, no wheat bun, but I appreciated being offered wheat toast instead (yes!), and the side salad was bigger than expected. Everything felt very reasonable for $9.  Only the lack of a distinctive bonus - house veggie burger, grilled onions, etc - prevents a clean sweep of stars. But it's a solid four, and one of the better financial district burger spots.

1yeS87Cj8DhbLXSLYxzIzw.review_text: You've gotta order one of the burgers here. It's a BURGER place, first and foremost. I went with friends and wasn't really in the mood for one, but it seemed like the right thing to do. Turns out, it was a fabulous burger. Cheese and pesto. We sat outside on a lovely autumn day. Good thing we did, because later when I went inside to use the rest room, I found myself blasted by the volume of the TV and other diners. This Friday lunchtime crowd was very noisy.

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: Finally made it here and it's Margarita night!  $4 for tall margaritas from 4pm till close!  Let me just say that they are generous on the tequila :)  So that's definitely a great start and hubby was happy with the many drafts available.  We got in slightly after 7pm and were still able to order food.    Hubby got the Fat Tire and I got the margarita, after all, how can anyone turn down a $4 tall margarita?  One sip and my first reaction was "wow, they are generous on alcohol!" and hubby took a sip and agreed.  I think I'll be returning on Thursdays just for this.  Now food, I remember reading about their burger and one of the bartenders confirmed it.  Hubby got the mushroom brie burger with fries and I decided with the fried chicken with mashed potatoes w/ gravy and some veggies.  The burger was cooked to order, medium rare and the brie was a great combination.  The fries were perfectly crispy, great when hot but still good when it cooled down.  My fried chicken - there were 3 pieces - one each of the wing, thigh and breast.  It was very crispy but pretty tasty.  I only had the wing and thigh since I'm not a white meat person.  Hubby had it and said it was a bit dry.  However, the mashed potato was SO GOOD - it was lumpy so you can taste the real potato and the gravy was good.  The bartenders, Sean and Kevin, were both friendly.  Sean also made a spice pear martini for me - some special and it was tasty.  Again, generous on alcohol.  The regular patrons were very friendly.  We struck up a good conversation with a few and perhaps we'll run into them again.  A great neighborhood gem.  If there's a fault, it would be that they close early around 9pm...

kzkAXy9mJS6gMljzC4xGXw.review_text: If you want great burgers that are really filling and not overpriced, then this is the place. Their signature sandwiches are really good too. Word of caution; it gets really busy during lunchtime and try to ignore the sides and focus on the burger/sandwich itself or you'll find yourself full in no time.

_sDR1ZfOQuaauOFUSlveDQ.review_text: Damn good burgers and the fries were just as good. There are only a few places that can cook a burger to order and this is one of them.

TAZ2UvEzXXbieQMCWn8qhw.review_text: I've crashed some private parties here and had the time of my life goodtimes.   Totally time of my life and memorable. I gotta say they have one of the best happy hours here too. Every happy hour is like a huge party.  This place is soo conveniently located too.  The burgers are really good and huuuuuge. I danced on a table here once and no I didn't fall, skills.

JSPE5bMOg6rAKvKVEdfIXw.review_text: I order to go all the time for work lunch, but last night's service was a little ridiculous. The owner was hosting a private party with 7 people in the back of the restaurant and had the only server and bus boy completely focused on him and his group. That left the poor bartender, who was super nice and was doing his best to get us square away, to serve our party of 6 plus the few other couples that wandered in. We weren't more than 5 feet from the bar, but it meant that every time we wanted to order a drink or order  appetizers that we had to go up to the bar and put in the order. After the first 30 minutes, the bartender then came out and took our dinner order (to be honest, it was when he realized that no one else was going to do it who should have been taking care of us and took it upon himself to fix it).   When I have to watch someone polish wine glasses and set a table with candles and a white table cloth while waiting 15 minutes for someone to come over and ask if we want a drink  - there's something wrong. Oh and did I mention that we even started to bus our own table? Meanwhile, there were custom made plates of off-menu items being rolled out to his private party.  I hope that the owner reads this - and DO NOT take it out on your bartender, not his fault and he was flawless with us. Close down your place if you're hosting a private dinner party or go take them out to somewhere else where it doesn't disrupt your business.

IxKVvGmFIEz77YYL-5_YxA.review_text: I've been working two blocks away for almost a year and only today did I try Grumpy's. What the hell have I been doing all this time?  I had lunch here with a coworker at around 12:45 on Tuesday and it was pretty busy. There are quite a few tables for a small place and a few tables outside. The street is pretty quiet, but noisy enough to enjoy the bustle of outdoor seating.   They serve the typical pub grub bites, but they focus on burgers. They probably have over ten combinations to choose from and give you the option of beef, turkey, or veggie patty. I ordered the Cafe Style Burger with avocado and sprouts with a side salad. I was surprised to see they served a legit side salad with carrots, tomatoes, cucumber, kidney beans, garbanzo beans, black olives, and wait for it...a slice of hard boiled egg. That side salad could have been a meal on its own. Other than salad, you could choose fries, onion rings, or if you're like the lady who sat next to me, mozzarella sticks with your sandwich. All of this food for under $10. It's a pretty good deal. The ingredients could have been a bit fresher, but other than that, no complaints.   They also have a really decent selection of draft beers. No Budweiser or Coors Light here, at least not on tap. They serve Mirror Pond, Stella, Anchor Steam, Firestone, Dos Equis, Hefeweizen, and some others for only $5. They have Guinness and Boddington's for $6.

2obAyPuH-G3Dn3EUdQnQlA.review_text: drinks always seem cheap. and stiff.

UC0DrrNqqzgdiclxazjesg.review_text: Walked by a bunch of times so had to give it a try. Packed at lunch time, close enough from the fin district to make the walk. Burger was good, not amazing... Same with the fried chicken. Beers on tap rock, loved the boddingtons-like red hen. What makes the place special is the cool bar atmosphere, loaded with people, fun hang out, good for afternoon sports.

0DAJCCZcwsftU0gX5C0P7A.review_text: Grumpy's is an interesting mix of an English pub, Fidi / Ad agency lunch spot.  The small, bustling little brick building delivers some tasty burgers, fried chicken, and generous portions of the greens (definitely a plus).    Full bar, and plenty of beers to choose from, so don't be shy... treat yourself to some alcoholic refreshments.  Speaking of shy, you'll probably need to be aggressive about flagging someone to take your order.  And don't come here if you're in a rush either.  Love the name of this place too.

fB8AWUP4lYhHTz70aWbwlw.review_text: Good Grub, great sandwiches, outdoor seating (but limited).  Casual environment but not a dive bar.  Good experience everytime I'm there.  Would warrant one more star if the service was faster than slooow.

u2llfHvzBvfjvRxKm3wyeg.review_text: I write my reviews, usually, when I want to gripe - not often enough to pay a compliment - and this is no exception.  Been eating at Grumpy's once a month or so for a few years - usually take out for a working lunch. I'll call in the order about 11:30 for a noon pickup - usually it's only a five minute wait when I go to pick it up.   Not this time.  Apparently they screwed up, and made the tuna sandwich I ordered, but forgot the hamburger. Shit happens. But I say apparently because they never told me anything about a delay. Five minutes....ten minutes...finally I grab someone to find out what's going on. They tell me the burger is being made.  It's 12:20, more than 40 minutes after placing the order that I get my food. And worse than all that - they were rude about the whole thing!! As they finally gave me my food - still no explanation, the waitress gives a bland "sorry for the wait, hey can I give you a chili or a soup or something". As I'm about to walk out the door with the overdue order.  I told her, "I just want to get out to my meeting, the time for a gesture like that would have been ten minutes ago while I was standing there like an idiot" and she got all snippy with me.  Time to find a new burger joint

RWUKFRBQxwsgKMFVa3m3Dw.review_text: Went here for a quick bite before going to the exploratorium for the day. I had a Baja burger with garlic fries. The burger was decent and their regular fries were nice and crispy. But the garlic fries are not worth it... it's just regular fries with a teaspoon of garlic paste on top. The paste made the fries a bit soggy... and it wasn't even tossed with the fries, just placed on top of them...

Vp6rrcLo9MrubLNAJ4rOPw.review_text: I'm a little upset knowing this business was partly responsible for keeping Off the Grid away from the area (Vallejo and Front). But I can understand why they'd do it.  However, I've come here a few times anyway. Once, I asked the bartender for some drink... let's say it was a Lagunitas. He didn't have it or there was some problem with the carbonation. So I asked for a... let's say Racer 5. There's no way I can remember exactly what beer I asked for. Same problem.  So he gave me a free beer. And for that reason, I will forever be loyal to Grumpy's. Thank you, cool bartender. You were also very fast and hard-working, virtues I admire.

wcwH3HDVkIi9J90XzCZJkQ.review_text: Solid bar food, good drink selection. Cheap drinks, moderate food prices. Friendly staff. Would definitely go again.  And you might run into the occasional ABC, CBS, NBC TV/ News people there.  Celebrity siting so far- Mike Roe from Dirty Jobs and Jaime Heyiman (sp) from Myth Busters 3 1/2 stars.

ZOzNbglhE2ohPg0tQkvWlA.review_text: This place rocks....okay so I've only been once, but in that one time I ended up shot gunning beers with the bar tender, closing down the bar (after kicking a shaddy character out), and sticking around to play my first ever round of dice for horrible tequila shots (poor greg.....).   This is one of my top ten favorite bars! Locals only, yet somehow they let me hang.

FysXnUshJOvFkCl5nz_tKw.review_text: Best damn burger in the Financial Dist if not the city! Just ate there again today with 3 other compadres. The freakin burger was perfect. Soft warm bun...nicely melted gooey cheddar, and they even have Grey Poupon (best mustard) the rest is yellow/brownish crappola. Diet Coke was mixed to perfection. All in all great lunch. Even had a side show of a couple trying to have a meaningful conversation. This place is LOUD. Perfect for eating and certainly not reading some lame ass book at the bar while scarfing down a Mushroom burger. At least it wasn't a Starbuckian with a lap top.

G8o1w7m4Vn_VxJaHC4-7hg.review_text: Came in with my boyfriend for lunch and we weren't sure what to expect. We aren't from here and had been walking at the Exploratorium all day so we were starving. Rather than eating at the exploratorium we searched for a place nearby and found Grumpy's.   We walked in and were greeted and took a seat. They have a decent sized bar and a good amount of tables inside. We ordered off of their $5 draft menu- good deal, and each got a burger. The initially brought us both the same type of burger even though we ordered different but they handled it well and took one back and brought out the correct one,   The burgers were AHHHMAZING. The patties were thick and juicy, and the toppings we got were yummy. I got my burger with onion rings instead of fries and they were the best onion rings I've ever had. The fries were crispy and delicious too. If we were in town again we would definitely come by again. This place is totally a dive bar but they put out some good food. Must try!

qI1o7LA-Fegcs5xpxRvTaQ.review_text: I might be making a mistake in getting my food to go from here. Even when i called ahead, showed up after they said it would be ready, i still waited.  The point of take out is you don't have time to sit and eat. Any how the burgers are decent, I like the brie mushroom, and they get points for many different flavors, toppings.

hq36rzGMbnoK17ZZc7zIvQ.review_text: When I worked near Levi Plaza, I always kicked off my weekend with happy hour at Grumpy's. Great prices - $3 Tecate was always a popular choice. Their food is excellent as well. Try the veggie burger, you won't be disappointed. Grumpy's can get pretty packed around 5, but it usually clears out by 7:30 or so.

M271Ac7UKVaQ9U5AOvc_9A.review_text: I'm slowly beginning to infiltrate my circle of friends: they're starting to use Yelp more and more and discovering just how awesome it is.  Case in point: Happy Hour suggestions around Financial District/the Embarcadero brought up Grumpy's.  I never even knew this place existed, and I would've easily passed it over since it's really nonchalant and the entryway is small and it sits in the middle of warehouses and office buildings on Vallejo.  Parking there after 6 PM is super easy, and the place wasn't busy at all.  Chicken strips and fries were delish (as opposed to the T.I. Bar & Grill, ew), and even though I'm not a beer fan, theirs didn't make me gag as much as it usually does.  Really super chill, laid-back place (although the other groups in there at the time were REALLY loud so it was kind of hard to have a conversation).  Overall an excellent place to rewind after work.  Too bad it's not closer to the main part of the Financial District - but then again, maybe it's good that it's NOT closer because then it'd be WAY packed and I'd be sad because I'd have to wait for my food.

L45t1jlp0aR2wY3_reiqDg.review_text: Two words: Sean and Kevin. These are hands down my two favorite bartenders in the city. Even my boyfriend loves them. Go meet them. You will thank me. Pitchers are the best value, burgers are fantastic. and there is dice behind the bar. Doesn't get much better than that. Now if they were only open for brunch...

aEKUC4oQg2CokbwyW_CXSg.review_text: totally reliable if you're in the hood and looking for pub food. good grilled cheese and tuna melt. love the tuna burger popeye style - feta and spinach - yum! if you're hungover at work and need a bit of grease hit it up.

ndic8ChsAW6zqtBjpHFqvg.review_text: OK I went there again and now there are four reasons i like Grumpy's. One, the food is good. Two, the service is awesome. Three, the price is right. Four, the turkey burger is tasty. You have to check this place out. It lacks pretension and feels like home; a good home ;).

3WFYabnCc8OXJwupgC8WuA.review_text: Love the burgers here. It's a fun, little place.

v9GJDjFkS0IvCw83k-D1xQ.review_text: This place is attached to my work is both really cool and sad at the same time.  Its really cool because this place is really good. The burgers are always juicy. Last time I was here I tried the Super. After seeing my friends enjoy their burgers with a fried egg on it at the New Zealander I decided to go with the Super at Grumpy's because it comes with a fried egg, cheddar cheese, and my favorite condiment...bacon.  The burger was perfectly cooked and juicy as usual. The egg added an extra richness to the burger...it has a soft yoke so it ran everywhere. The bacon added a crispy crunch and bacon flavor.  The fries are pretty good too. Crisp but not over cooked.   The bartenders and wait staff have always been friendly and they do have some good beers on Tap, Anchor Steam yum.  The sad part is I don't get here enough.

vpDL3b-E_SSCCmRjDn9pMQ.review_text: the pub obviously wasn't named for the demeanor of the staff.  the servers and bartenders were sweet, smiling, and good natured.  but the 4 stars is for the speed with which our HUGE lunches were served, the diverse burger menu, and the bang for your lunch buck.  like they understand that you only have 1 hour for lunch, and half of that is taken up by transit to and from the office.  the staff was quick, the burgers filling, and the taste: sensational.  i wouldn't recommend the onion rings, but the side salads are enormous and the toppings on the burgers took up half the plates!  not to mention that you could have your burger in beef, turkey, chicken, or tofu!!!  i would recommend the turkey burger: it wasn't dry like most turkey burgers, and perfectly seasoned.  i can't wait to go back and try one of everything.  thank goddess for a new lunch destination in the northern embarcadero waterfront!  oh, but you will leave smelling like a giant french fry.  consider yourself warned.

-rvWoBbXarvmL64kfaymQQ.review_text: Excellent beer selection in bottles and draft.  Burgers are very good.    Went for the first time with a small group from work (there were five of us).  We got here at about 5:45 and most tables were available but the bar was full - if the weather had not been decent I think people at tables outside would have been in and the seating woukd have been tighter.  Within half an hour the place was PACKED.    You need to know how to operate.  Grab a table first, decide what you want, go to the bar and order your food and drink.  Carry your drinks to the table yourself and repeat as necessary until you are ready to close out then go to the bar to pay.  They bring the food to you and will fetch and carry condiments, et cetera.    One of our number wanted salad and the menu shows several.  Salad was not to be had.  We did not investigate whether this was a normal circumstance or a fluke but I would not get a salad here, the burger was just too good.  Everyone liked what they had.  All burgersnwere ordered medium and they came out exactly right, not too bloody and not too much grease dripping on the plate.    We had a regular burger, a russian burger, a cheeseburger, another burger that came with avocado, and a grilled cheese sandwich.  Fries were good, thicker cut (not steak fries but not skinny fries that are so popular).  The American eatwr among us was very please that American cheese was available for the grilled cheese.  Next time we are wondering where to go for a divey experience but not completely gross, we'll come here.

92X37S-hY1cYhl4IgedpMA.review_text: This is a nice off the beaten path pub, that is relatively cheap, close to work, has out door patio, and excellent food. . .   its simple, they serve good food, they have beer and top chef, its a good little place to sit out and enjoy the weather with out the mobs of financial district over flow you get at lunchtime...  ill keep this one just that simple folks.. oh and someone noted that this is one of the better burgers around, and they are right on...

EAUrXj9VgqYvGuPYEVYOJw.review_text: You can definitely come here and get something a bit on the lighter side. I had the 'summer salad' - with mango, avocado, feta, chicken, onions and garbanzos. Sooo delish.   On top of that, a great crowd to experience the World Cup game with!

PlBEWKn8-ChFeiH1oUYFmQ.review_text: Haven't been here after hours to enjoy the beers yet but the lunches are damn good. Tons of items to choose from including a Shrimp Po'boy that's really good. I no longer have to wish that McDonald's will one day start selling the shrimp filet like they have in Japan.

QvUGS_jz_tbmD7YSjxMc6A.review_text: Good service, nice ambience, and great drinks! It wasn't that crowded on a Monday night, which I don't mind at all. It's a nice place to chill with the game on and alternative music playing. I was there for the happy hour which had only drinks, no food despite the website.

zpnd-D0-ahcfrYYLvt04oA.review_text: A little tight at lunch time, but the friendly staff makes you comfortable regardless of how close your neighbor is.  The turkey burger is wonderful, but bring a breath mint for after lunch.

epIp3mfCqrtGGsKAcbsdBg.review_text: I work nearby and even hosted a happy hour here for colleagues. Friendly service, busy and happy atmosphere and great specials ;-)

TMt47-ghHgy7hVSgvGXhQA.review_text: Wow, I have a feeling I'm not in Kansas any more. Or am I? I used to come here back in 2005 and had nothing but great service and good vibes. I met old coworkers from that era tonight and suddenly, I'm in the movie "Deliverance". "drop them britches, come on now..."   Seriously. The bartender had a buddy that continued to call me every variation of f@9 over the course of an hour. I placated the guy offering to buy him drinks until he combusted into a rage of anti-f@9ness and the bartenders (both male and female) told me to take a free drink and leave. Ultimately the bartender asked me "who am I" to be there, "we don't know you" and laid down the law for me. I had no right to be there cause his fraternity buddy felt that he should reconcile my "gayness" with the sword of the lord.  Funny, my wife watched in horror at the table on the side. Nice work Grumpy's employees! If I ever thought of being g@y, you taught me otherwise!

wkv0w6P9IgXLCpL6y0MFOg.review_text: I've admittedly become somewhat obsessed with Grumpy's. I work right across the street making it super easy to phone in an order and hop over to pick it up. Their pub grub is pitch perfect. Grumpy's burgers, sandwiches and appetizers are on point. The ingredients are fresh and prepared right. They have great drink specials and they atmosphere is cozy and welcoming. The staff is friendly and the prices are low. Doesn't get much better than that. I love it.

0FicklFFAcnBs03gF1ZnhQ.review_text: It is a good after work place.... no boohaahaas.... nice & friendly bartenders...  Mostly filled with ppl from abc & nearby offices which makes it better for me to be around since I dont see my own kind.   It is my kinda place & would definitely recommend it for my friends.

Xk8z-5q-FnGfLrofwq5jWg.review_text: This is a bar.  A bar with food.  No frills.  Working just around the corner...you can say that I've been here quite a bit.  They have a full bar and the usual suspects for beers on tap.  Their food is above average for a bar.    If you're going for lunch, beware that on Friday's it will be packed and it may take awhile.  They do claim they serve breakfast, but I showed up at 9ish and their kitchen wasn't open yet, so it may be hit or miss.    I've only gone to this place during the weekdays, with everything around it being offices, not sure what the scene is like during weekends.

O8i10nA3Dh1bfqF1IWWvrA.review_text:
Looking for a great burger and fries? Grumpy's is the place. Four stars if the service wasn't horrible. 
  My diet coke conundrum continues...poor fountain diet coke. don't. do. it. Peraps it's best to stick with a beer..many from which to choose. 
  Grumpy's is a bit crowded at lunch, but this spot is perfect if you are hungover and need some salt and grease.
  The service is incredibly slow. I waited for one hour and 10 minutes for food today. This is quite UNacceptable as I only have an hour for lunch. The waiter dood was stellar, but it would have been nice for him to inform us what the hold up was. Only after inquiring about our food did he mention the to-go orders were being processed first. Oh, and the three tables that arrived after us but served first was a let down. 
  No. fun.

LIEQubFyKBjLwriPRPv9fg.review_text: Grumpy burger! And a beer! My favorite burger place in that part of town. Don't be fooled by the pub-like appearance. (wait, it IS a pub). The burgers are great. Absolutely tasty. And the fries are good as well. Why 4 stars? Everything I've tried besides the burgers has been pretty much ho-hum. So, if you like a pub-like choice of beer and a really good burger, and, by the way, outside seating on a sunny day. This is the place.

44IpM6ma8qY0i7MTEStH5A.review_text: Best burgers in town cooked perfectly and the meat is what ground beef should taste like.  I'm not sure if you have had fresh ground beef, but it will have a hint of sweetness to it and melt in your mouth.  The Boddingtons is my favorite beer to wash down the burger with the fries or salad or onion rings or baked potato skins.  The prime rib sandwich is also something to try the next time you are there.

gjZp61JZaqcLrKjEDVSPIQ.review_text: Good burgers and large salads.  They can be too busy on Fridays at lunch time.

QxicE6c4zNxYYJh_aeywlA.review_text: Why art thou open for breakfast?   Hash from a can, day old ice tea, menu says potatoes but they didn't come. Sourdough toast became wonder bread. Found old macaroni on my eggs. Weird. So again..... why art thy open for breakfast?

Dp9vtkpgNti0BuG3202PGQ.review_text: i was organizing a co-worker's goodbye party and searching for a place with outdoor searching.  I called Grumpy's to ask if they had enough outdoor seating for 20+ people, and they said "Definitely! Come on by!"  When we arrived, there were two tiny tables (prob enough seating for 7-8 ppl, max) outside in front, and both were already taken. Sad face.    I also didn't discern anything particularly unique or outstanding about this bar....food & drinks were average in quality and taste, and the decor was pretty standard. In sum: meh.

gNzC6OJIdRlSkEQIZuP8QQ.review_text: Aside from always being able to count on Grumpy's for a quality burger, this place has got to go down (along with Old Ship Saloon a few blocks away) in the books and its role in the history of San Francisco's budding advertising industry. Evidenced by placards like publicis and cutwater that are part of its decor, this restaurant is tucked away between the embarcadero and financial district and is always a good place for a solid burger for lunch and a cold frosted beer after work (or lunch!)

vZ5yebmRxe4H4_mb6164gw.review_text: Bad Service. Came in with over a dozen people after a professional mixer & all bought food/drinks. We sat outside & noticed a few glass/plates left over from the previous group. Went inside to ask the bartender if he could have someone come out & buss the table, his response: "This is just a bar, move a few glasses over yourself." I was little dumbfounded by that response, most bars have employees who buss tables not customers who clean up after other customers. What's unfortunate is that he spoiled my experience there, the bartender who previously made me a drink was very friendly. I won't be returning or recommending this bar.

uSCYNal_CJDPGBYUAenyoA.review_text: If this was the kind of place with friendly people, and they could make a decent Hamburger, and you could get a no fuss beer at 4PM for $5 bucks including tip, it would have a nice neighborhood bar charm. But it's not, they can't, and you will need to shell out at least 40% more than that. Very limited reasons to come here. Pressed to think of one, I'd say if you're looking for the lower standards and banality of a trip down I-5 without the hassle of leaving the city, may be your kind of place.

t1UZNFVtkDAYi1YGwzhJKg.review_text: If my stomach could speak, it would say one word about these burgers...'AWESOME!'  I love this place! I usually check this place out for lunch about 3 times a month if not more.  The burger patties are actually quarter pounders when they are cooked not before they grill them.  The meat is cooked to your liking and is always juicy and tender.  My favorite burger is the bacon cheeseburger. Standard, however you will never be disappointed.  Another bonus, is the steak fries and onion rings are cooked to perfection.  They are never overcooked or soggy like some other places.  This place definitely gets a two thumbs up with a fork and spoon ready to eat rating.  Downside, this place is a pub and rather small so if you are in a big group try to get there early before the lunch rush.

rCABzIrH4JtqqAqBOsMtFw.review_text: I work only 3 blocks away, so we end up ordering lunch from "Ye olde standby" frequently. There are many options or "styles" of burgers, which keeps things interesting if you're eating here every other week. Also, their salads are always fresh and delicious. Although recently, they've been skimping on the dressing, big time. Seriously, less than half a plastic cup of vinaigrette for my whole salad?  "Who is responsible for this, Jorge?!?"  The service is efficient and friendly. The pub-like interior is a authentic mix of brick, dollars stuck to the ceiling, and old (and current) ad agency logos and signs, which is appropriate, considering the neighborhood.  Additionally, it's a fun place to hang out with friends after work. If it's nice out, grab a seat at a sidewalk table. Or sit inside and watch some senior citizens play baseball on TV.... Oh! Those ARE the Giants. Just kidding Giants, I love you guys.

oJ6bb4wnKCNT8v4U53FzFA.review_text:
Don't be surprised if a Yardbird or even Paul McCartney himself saddles up next to you at the bar. Not only does Grumpy's serve up what I'm inclined to name the BEST BURGER IN SAN FRANCISCO, but it's also the closest I've come to finding the perfect English Pub. 
  Its brick walls, Brit charm and sweet ass mascot (Grumpy the Bulldog) make this tucked away restaurant feel like your boggy home away from home. Wide selection of beer, wine and spirits - including Jager on tap. And as if the booze alone isn't enticing enough, their menu will find a place in your little limey heart. Burgers prepared a dozen ways (try the Western style veggie burger with bacon!), salads to cure your scurvy, and soups to warm your soul. 
  Parking won't kill you (bring quarters!) and you're bound to see a few interesting characters eating solo at the bar. Don't forget to check out the ceiling... you never know what just might fall into your lap...

RGrlRPQKVMeALP_Pj8MrMA.review_text: i love hole in the walls!  I had a yummy burger and they had great selection of their specialty burgers. i love it.  call me boring but i still just go for mushroom and swiss burgers :DD  next time ill sit out doors... i love outdoor seating!!!

z-hwsFeY66kqMVTMCp9w-A.review_text: Ahh Grumpy's...how I enjoy your burger. Why must people always occupy your space when I desire sustenance from your kitchen? I will have to come back another day and taste that savory burger even though I must shed more money that I would like.

RbHAajSUNYKtX3IC6wzFGQ.review_text: How can you not love a classic Barbary Coast style pub?  Ok, so you're not going to be robbed or get into a fight at lunchtime, but there is still a trap-door in the floor where you can imagine old drunkards being drugged and sent off to sea for an involuntary trip to Shanghai.  Sadly I think they now use the trapdoor for transporting veggie burgers.  If only the Sidney Ducks knew what became of their stomping grounds... Honestly I have nothing unique to contribute about this place that hasn't already been written: I just wanted my name to appear next to the Grumpy moniker.  That and to profess my love for my Friday lunch haunt, which satisfies a fix for what I think is the best turkey burger in the city.   The burger's come in a multitude of options, but almost always I go with the "Popeye" which features spinach and feta - I am'z what I am'z cause I eats my spinach.  The fries are perfect (but they don't travel well so dine-in).  If you don't want fries you can go the side-salad route, knowing that Grumpy's serves up a far better side-salad than you deserve to get in a bar.  Seriously, who goes to a pub for a salad?   Everything I've had at Grumpy's rates well.  Salads too.  I have a friend who is eating his way down the menu and it never ceases to surprise us how each offering is seemingly better than expected.  Grumpy's is just very good.  It is also busy and loud.  There is some outside seating but I'm always cold so that's not the best option if your cold-blooded too. Go, have a pint, have some fries and try not to end up on a ship out to sea.  Although I hear Shanghai is lovely this time of year. Check out the menu at: grumpys.citysearch.com

DjNb1nsTKIsIf75n994DAw.review_text: Really, Truly, Actually, a Very Good Hamburger.  Plain and Simple.  Good Hamburger.

9xyeYXwrhS8OdnvoM0mDjQ.review_text: Fair to say Grumpy's serves the best burger in the financial district.  No knock on Burger Bistro or Gotts-something - that fancy nancy place at the Ferry Bldg, but they've been trumped.  A burger order comes w/ either fries or potato/mixed salad.  Ordered the Cafe burger, the one w/ avocado.  About a half pound patty cooked just right.  Damn it was delicious.  All the burgers are $10-12...definitely worth it for the pound of food you get.  The location is quite nice since it's kind of segregated from the more densely populated areas, so there's not much of a wait for your food...usually 5-7 minutes.

GXQobSAaAxRap5g1cif6Jg.review_text: The perfect after work (or during work) bar.    The bartenders are adorable and there's great beer on tap, stiff drinks, and solid bar snacks.  The clientele, a quirky mix of advertising creatives and other random individuals, make it even better.  Plus, there's nothing like sitting outside on a nice day and soaking in the sunshine, booze and lively conversation.

ng7FuYH6Byo2MfJcymW9oQ.review_text: I went here for lunch today and ordered the salmon. It was raw in the middle and was missing the veggies it was supposed to come with, so I sent it back.  The exact same piece of salmon came back out, charred black. I also got veggies this time but they were mushy. I was starving so I ate them anyway, but I sent the salmon back again. They cooked a fresh piece of salmon for the third attempt, but this too came out raw in the middle. Come on, now. Salmon, like most fish, cooks quickly. I was too tired to try again, and it had been over an hour, so the waitress just took it off my bill. That was nice of her, but I won't be going back.

KgEI0pJ10070F72hmJjZVw.review_text: Best bar and grill in the Financial District for sure. The tuna melt is delicious. So are the onion rings. If you want a healthier side, the salad is also really good...they use fresh ingredients and spice it up with garbanzo beans. They always give me extra pickles...I don't even have to ask! It's like the waitresses read my mind or something! Anyway, the service is great, too. Even if it's super crowded, you can get in and out within an hour. I still haven't made it over there for happy hour, only because it's a bit of a hike from BART, but look forward to trying it soon!

L-q_mELxM0hwzIZ0ebiX8w.review_text: Love Grumpy's. Turkey Pastrami on Rye is awesome.  Whole burger variety menu is nice.  Staff is friendly and has always been accommodating with large groups and/or baby.

ifbxnJKHhXMWxzXAkTxdEQ.review_text: My fiance and I stumbled on Grumpy's when we were visiting the city last week. We read the yelp reviews and were very excited to try their burgers. Let me tell you, they did not disappoint! The burgers were well cooked and the ingredients were fresh. I got the salad with my burger and this was no iceburg lettuce and ranch. The salad was packed full of yummy things including eggs, kidney beans and cucumbers!  The burgers were good and the beer was cold... Stop in and try it!

CqvkW-20AAtYG1vaklCZhA.review_text: Well, I'm old school at this place, been going here since 1982, in fact before it was named Grumpy's.  For the old timers, they'll remember it as McGovern's.  This place is a classic and since I've been going there, the place has seen the rise of the TV stations grow around it (KPIX, KGO & KNTV), to the sprouting of numerous radio stations and of course the arrival and demise of various ad agencies around it.  Then it's seen the ol' 480 freeway demolished after the quake of '89 and following that the dot com boom and the ensuing bust and here we go again, another rally with the hi-tech industry, hence Web 2.0.  That's a brief history surrounding Grumpy's, now you're up to speed.  But what's consistent about Grumpy's (I'm not a lunch crowd type there, but a frequent after-work crowd...huge dif), is how their bartenders (several over the years) somehow always attain a true and sincere measure of grumpiness.  After they've been working there awhile, they all turn out like Jack Nicholson in the Shining, "all work and no play makes Jack a dull boy."  In the end, it is a neighborhood bar that happens to be in the Barbary Coast business section at the edge of the stuffy Financial District at the foot of Telegraph Hill.  There aren't too many suits, but they're welcome anyway for a drink or so.  Meanwhile, whole tribes from several neighboring companies come to unwind after work, wax poetic about their day's toils and even mingle with members of the other tribes.  It is a friendly bar, not because of the bartenders, but because of the patrons.  So if you come, brace yourself for an unfriendly service, but be entertained by the shenanigans of the natives...most likely to be seen after 5 pm.  Update as of December 2008.  They have a cool new bartender, Sean.  So, Sean, we're waiting for the day your turn ahem, Grumpy.

tml-uIQirNz6YGwbO71sGA.review_text: Oh my God that was a tasty meal. I had  the chicken basil sandwich. Best one I have had in years. The chicken was juicy, not dry like lots of palces I go to. I work over at the Piers,a nd I mentioned it for lunch. SO I got food to go, and everybody is praising this place in my office. I will be going back, next time with friends for drinks and dinner.

H2FahZmg6BKHOFaLnUXgsQ.review_text: DISCLAIMER: I'm rating Grumpy's as a vegetarian. The atmosphere was great and the rest of the my party enjoyed their dishes.  I had the veggie burger. It was one of the worst I've had. Almost definitely frozen, thin patty, disappointing bun. Left me hungry and underwhelmed. Besides the veggie burger, I can't even remember any other non-meat options.   Please add veg dishes!!

bUoYRrYBZWhBsVgkwqQnXQ.review_text: Ahh The Grumps. This place has become a staple for those of us that work in the area. I have been known to frequent Grumpys as many as 4 times in one day. They have great burgers especially because you can have any version with your choice of turkey, veggie, chicken, or beef. Staff is cool and they great happy hour specials. A very respectful crowd except yo get your occasional ad douche. Some of them even get their pictures on the wall.

cR5ZY_fa3ciB4etcm6IPbA.review_text: Yet another place I settle for to get lunch. They have pretty good burgers, and the Southern Fried Chicken is not that bad. Obviously I don't expect much from a pub, but a life saver when you don't know what you want for lunch.  This place is definitely popping after work, though.

WmfvEE9bXozI8slUtJkCNA.review_text: Yes. You should go. Order the following... don't even look at the rest of the menu. Turkey Burger is the best I have ever had... so much flavor.  And I love cows, I mean I avoid turkey burgers on general principle but wow... order it.  And get it Baja style... and of course for beer... i love a good beer menu too... of course a Hefeweizen for Jessica :-)  It's a small place so you might have to share a table or at the very least sit close enough to make new friends.  There are a few tables outside though.  Love it! Go!

tcqi5sCJdmD-fVVuqUkJtQ.review_text: Great burgers and good service. This place is a casual place to grab a beer and munch on some good pub food. I had the cafe style angus burger with garlic fries and I wasn't disappointed. The burger was big and juicy and the fries had mounds of garlic on them. I LOVE garlic so this was a big plus in my book. The bar has a good selection of beers on tap too. I recommend this place for a fun, casual get together with friends while in the city.

q6edB0RvhEz5z8bWqNYcyA.review_text: Grumpy's is my version of Cheers. You won't find a better place to get a drink and pub food at after 10 hours of working in an ad agency where your co-workers back stab you, your clients put your work down, and it's been the day from hell.  The bartenders, Mary and Sean, treat you like family. And the strangers at the bar become fast friends. Come by for a drink sometime!

POxbvBd34HTMO-UZ8jEbbA.review_text: Let me describe my experience...its long...but its valuable and embelished only where necessary....  Two co-workers and I walked down to Grumpy's over a Friday lunch break to grab a burger and a beer.  We had heard that their burgers were awesome, and wanted to give it a shot since it was in walking distance from our office.  We assumed we could get in & out of there in an hour to an hour and 15 minutes, but man were we wrong!  We were seated and given abundant time to review the menu before our waiter finally came over to take our orders.  I ordered a western burger, while my two buddies ordered the same burger...only one with no mayo and fries....the other as-is with potato salad.  We also got a beer-a-piece.  About 30 minutes and a pint later, it dawns on us that 1) our food has not arrived, and 2) the two tables that were seated 10 minutes after us were at least 8 bites into their lunches.  After one friend mutters the token, "What...are they killin' the cow back there?" the bus boy comes by to ask us if we need a refresher on our brewskies.  We collectively agreed, "We've got no food to cram in our mouths, so bring us another round, bus boy!"  (side note: our waiter was not seen for these 30 minutes)  Just as the bus boy brings us our 2 beers (side note: we ordered 3!!), we noticed our waiter crawled out of the black hole he fell in and was bringing out our food.  (side note: 40 minutes had passed from the time we ordered)  The orders were screwed up...everything had mayo on it and one guy got the other's potato salad...it was a mess.  Once the mayo mistake was brought to the attention of the our re-established waiter, he opted to go back to the kitchen and bring out a plain bun to my buddy and had him take care of it himself.  Nice work.  After all of this, we were pretty torqued, but were happy with the results of the burgers.  They were tasty.  (side note: 1 hr. and 15 min. had passed from ordering to finishing the food)  Since our waiter was paying no attention to us, we had to flag him down like a airport runway worker just to get our check.  Then...surprise!! ...he brought us the wrong bill.  For 3 guys consuming 3 burgers and 5 beers, he was charging us $115.  Our calm, happy-go-Friday demeanors were slipping to the dark side.  I called to him from two tables away saying, "This is not our check."  He went back, brought us a check for around $50-something and said, "Thanks for coming in today guys!!"  Our pleasure.  We promptly paid with cash, and left him a $5 tip.  (side note: we are not cheap restaurant guests, we just tip appropriately)  We begin walking down the sidewalk, back to our office after an hour and  1/2 lunch when we hear, "Hey guys!! Was something wrong??"  Our waiter, rigid and red-faced was chasing us down the sidewalk in search of an explanation.  Without missing a beat, we listed off all of the 7 or 8 GLARING errors that were made.  Waiter says, "Well, OK, I just wanted to know because I've been having problems with the kitchen all day."  Other niceties were exchanged and I ended by saying, "But my burger was good."    When I was a waiter, I would blame stuff on the kitchen too in order to save a tip, but this was b.s. because the dude was not even around for 90% of our lunch.  There is no way it was the kitchen's fault.  The bus boy gave us better service than he did, and he even screwed up by bringing two beers for three people.  Horrible, horrible experience.  But the burger was good.  There is no way I, or my two buddies, will be going back.

b1TLsiRhQdfbbXahqFkVtg.review_text: Fun place to meet up for a few cold ones after work on a weekday.  The food is almost all fried.  This is good, because if I start hitting the sauce at 6pm, I'm going to need something to soak it up. Like fried cheese.  If you have enough to drink here I suggest that you walk up the hill to crowbar for some really cheap drink and then cheap domestics at Showgirls.  When happy hour is 7 hours long... endless possibilities.

pZAktka6VfcXmUf4lWlBJQ.review_text: I'm going to miss being less than two blocks away from this place. The burgers and salads are pretty tasty, and the beer is cheap. What else do you need from a lunch and after work happy hour joint? I mean, really?

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: Stopped in last night with a co-worker to grab a burger on our dinner break...the burgers were really tasty and cooked exactly as ordered.  Fries were hot and crispy (surprisingly a lot of restaurants can't get their fries this way!) and the staff extremely helpful and not grumpy at all. I'll definitely be back, hopefully next time after work so I can sample some of the fine beers that they have on tap.

n4fPKtWk7MQVYL1rC6z9dw.review_text: If Grumpies succeeds in their fight to remove the Off the Grid food trucks from Front and Vallejo I will ensure I never patronize them again. And I will spread the word. Lunch options in the area are scant enough as it is. It makes no sense.

8Ces6YdT6j7BYycnZLrSng.review_text: Grumpy's is overrated in terms of the food. But a great place for drinks with friends and to let loose.  A group of 8 from the office went to try this place on recommendation of a very outspoken female co-worker. We sat inside, occupying 2 tables. We ordered 6 different burgers + one chicken, and one sandwich suggested by the waiter (I think it was ham & cheese, but I don't remember) for one of the girls (all ~$8, w/choice of: fries, potato or green salad). It took a while to get our order, after several rounds of beers & sodas.  To make the story short, I'm the only one who finished my burger (I was hoongry!!). Everyone in the group agreed that it wasn't very good. They gave me a weird look because my plate was clean - and I had to keep explaining that I was hungry. The co-worker lost all credibility on choosing our next lunch spot, but her knowledge about places in which to get drunk remains unmatched (she knows the bartenders by name).  Tip for inexperienced office workers (thought it was needed, after reading some reviews): Whenever we go to lunch in a group we pool our cash together to pay the bill and tip, or one person picks up the tab and we divide it later. We don't ask for separate bills in crowded and busy places like this one. Hope this helps!

WQ8XspqfeK9eZ1_sVFojeQ.review_text: A classic western pub of brick and glass. This is a square room smelling of beer - nothing wrong with that. There are beers for every taste, including old-school PBR and Olympia in bottles. I would have been really fired up to see Oly in a can, as it was  the first beer I ever had.   Sadly, I had to settle for iced tea, as I was at lunch with co-workers. The food was pretty good and the portions large. I had a "Manhattan Melt" - ham, turkey and Swiss. It was really just a club sandwich, but still tasty. And it was served with a savory, heaping helping of potato salad.

PrYgTaYYCTQoAsWe_TmSDA.review_text: Good food, cheap prices, and beers on tap. Dingy little hole in the wall bar, but a good spot to grab breakfast/lunch/dinner when in the financial district. Friendly service brings me back every time.

nAbwXrHgJx5BshmOcCRCZQ.review_text: The burger was bang'n and the fries were perfectly greased, salted, and crisped.  I would totally give this place 5 stars if they would just speed it up a bit.    $5 IPA not bad for the neighborhood - I'd go back! When a large group arrives after me and a friend, and then we get served after the group, it bothers me =(.  Other than the long wait (to eat, not sit or have our order taken), I have no complaints.

GFGRHcL4GYe0fRwWx7tazg.review_text: Went here weekly on Wednesdays after work to grab a beer and their $1 garlic fries!!!!!!!!!! I was three months from turning 21 but they never checked my id. Maybe I looked older with the people I was with.  It's a bit small but it sufficed. I noticed the people who came in were like me: just getting off of work and needed to relax with some booze. All the times I've been here, they always had a cute bartender that I stared at. haha. The last day I came in here, I was pretty drunk I wanted to get it off my chest so I told him he was cute. haha he thanked me and walked away.   ANYWAYS, this place has affordable appetizers and beers. It was my first bar too!

JUBRQxn471VP2X_SbxlpGw.review_text: Had lunch with a friend here.  Great service, good food (I had a chicken salad), and a decent beer selection.  It's a nice, laid-back place I'll definitely visit again.

E0hnzH2Kx50pYjIOhMxfuA.review_text: Went here to watch the final game between the Heat & Spurs with a co-worker. The crowd seemed pretty chill and liked the atmosphere but it was hard to get around with so many people.   They charge a fair price for their draft beers and their menu offers a good variety of food. I decided to get Lagunitas IPA on draft + a cheeseburger with fries.  The beer was cold and refreshing with the burger. The burger itself was seasoned adequately and hit the spot. While it wasn't anything out of the norm it was done well and I had no complaints.   Overall Thoughts  A good place to grab a bite and drinks with friends

TiPH2ZwSX53uK7IvFSHVYg.review_text: Fries, burger, onion rings, beer, and nice service. iJlfcUQx5ik28FltcnMY8Q.review_text: Attended a private party with about 50 people. Booze was great. But the food? Hamburgers were OK, but Grumpy's put out about 10 at a time for 50 people? Everything put out separately, then 15 minutes until the next thing. Fried chicken was OK if you don't mind ice cold in the center. This was precooked, then thrown into hot oil. Hot on the outside, but cold on the inside. One poor bartender had to work the whole room of 50 people, including serviing booze, putting out the little food they had, and clean up tables. One guy cooking in back. 2 of staff for the whole party of 50 people That's it. No bus boys, no waiters, no service. I'll bet they save a ton of money on labor and food supplies.
